- You must be an expert at video editing with multiple completed projects under your belt. You have to be really good—if you're NOT one of the best, this isn’t for you.

- You need 25-30 hours free each week. I need your focus and dedication to help grow this into something huge.

- I need someone who is passionate, committed, and ready to bring their A-game. If you’re not serious about your craft, don’t apply.



SUBMIT your portfolio when applying and be sure you read this whole post.

title: Virtual Assistant in Admin & Customer Service
description:
We’re seeking a Virtual Assistant to join our team. This role involves managing customer service tasks, organizing
 communications, and assisting with administrative responsibilities. You’ll play a key part in keeping operations smooth and customers happy.



Key Responsibilities:

- Handle all incoming customer communication from new and existing clients (calls,
s, messages)

- Support phone sales and convert inbound leads

- Manage scheduling, rescheduling, and service coordination

- Perform administrative tasks related to billing, invoicing, and records

- Manage and update customer records in our CRM

- Keep internal systems organized and updated

- Support process improvements and help keep operations moving efficiently

- Document processes and maintain organization across digital platforms like Gmail, Google Drive, and Slack.



Requirements:

- Fluent English, both written and spoken

- Clear, professional communication skills

- Strong organizational and time management ability

- Comfortable handling multiple tasks at once

- Solid technical skills and ability to learn new software quickly

- Problem-solver who takes ownership of outcomes

- Experience with customer service or sales support

- Leadership ability or interest in managing other VAs



What We Offer:

- Competitive salary

- Direct US company

- Paid time offs once regular

- Free training and development opportunities

- Yearly salary reviews

- Supportive and collaborative tea
mbers

- Stable, long-term role with room to grow

- Positive and service-focused work culture

- A professional team that values reliability, initiative, and improvement



We're hiring a Virtual Assistant for a long-term position with a knack for handling dynamic schedules, juggling multiple priorities, and staying two steps ahead. If you're not interested in a lasting role with growth opportunities and you don't have the qualifications, please do not apply.



But if this resonates with you, we look forward to your application!

title: Sales Associate
description:
Job description:



On the Go Moving and Storage is seeking a professional, customer obsessed individual to join our office team! You will be the first point of contact for our customers. Your primary responsibilities will include answering calls, closing sales, and dispatching movers and trucks. You will play a crucial role in ensuring a smooth and efficient moving process for our clients.



Performance Bonuses: Directly aligned with company profitability and measurable through how much you sell. Bonus payout monthly.

Since 2005 we have provided our customers with exceptional service and our employees with competitive wages and benefits. Check out our reviews on Google, Angieslist and Yelp!



A Day in the Life



Answering Calls: Respond to customer inquiries via phone and
, providing information about our services, pricing, and availability

Closing Sales: Convert inquiries into confirmed bookings by effectively communicating the benefits of our services and addressing any concerns

Dispatching Movers and Trucks: Coordinate and schedule the dispatch of movers and trucks, ensuring timely and efficient service delivery

Customer Support: Assist customers with any issues or questions they may have before, during, and after their move

Record Keeping: Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, bookings, and dispatch schedules

Team Collaboration: Work closely with the moving team to ensure all customer needs are met and any issues are promptly resolved.



Qualifications



Experience: Previous experience in customer service, sales, and/or dispatching

Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills along with active listening skills

Organizational Skills: Strong attention to detail, follow-through, and multitasking abilities (think - talking on the phone, typing and researching all at the same time)

Time Management Skills: The ability to juggle constant competing priorities

Problem-Solving: Ability to handle customer concerns and resolve issues efficiently

Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in using computer systems and software for scheduling and record-keeping

Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively with colleagues and contribute to a positive work environment

title: Amazon Online Arbitrage
description:
We are an Amazon wholesale and FBA business looking for a reliable Online Arbitrage Product Research Assistant to help us find profitable product leads for resale on Amazon.



This role is focused on sourcing deals from reputable retail and online stores and submitting profitable products for review.



Responsibilities



Search online retail websites for profitable resale opportunities on Amazon



Analyze product profitability using tools like Keepa, SellerAmp, RevSeller, Amazon Seller Central



Check for key factors including:



ROI and profit margin



Sales rank and demand



Competition and Amazon presence



Product variations and matching accuracy



Submit leads in a structured format with all required details



Follow general sourcing guidelines (brands, categories, pricing rules)

title: Community Enablement & Career Coach
description:
About the Role

The Career Services Coach supports members of LinkedIn-focused community through structured 1:1 coaching, audits, and implementation guidance. This role helps members improve their LinkedIn presence, resumes, and job-readiness while staying aligned with program teachings, ethical standards, and clearly defined scope.



Key Responsibilities

1. 1:1 Career Coaching (Structured & Bounded)

 • Conduct 1:1 coaching sessions with community members (based on plan tier or eligibility)

 • Support members with:

 • LinkedIn positioning and profile clarity

 • Resume strategy and improvement priorities

 • Job-search readiness and next steps

 • Keep sessions:

 • focused on implementation

 • aligned with program teachings

 • within defined time and frequency limits

 • Document key takeaways and next steps after sessions as needed



2. LinkedIn Profile Support

 • Review LinkedIn profiles and provide feedback on:

 • Headline positioning

 • About/Summary section clarity

 • Experience section structure

 • Guide members on visibility, credibility, and professional positioning

 • Ensure guidance is actionable and ethical

 • Align feedback with the program frameworks and teachings



3. Resume & Career Asset Reviews

 • Conduct resume audits focused on:

 • Clarity and structure

 • Impact-driven bullet points

 • Alignment with LinkedIn positioning

 • Provide feedback that helps members improve resumes without exaggeration or misrepresentation

 • Explain the reasoning behind recommendations so members can implement changes themselves



4. Ethical Resume Tailoring (Per Job Description)

 • Guide members on tailoring resumes to specific job descriptions by:

 • Highlighting relevant experience and transferable skills

 • Reordering and reframing existing content for relevance

 • Improving keyword alignment for screening systems

 • Maintain strict ethical standards:

 • No falsifying experience

 • No inflating titles

 • No misrepresentation of qualifications

 • Focus on truthful positioning and clarity



5. Structured Support via Ticketing System

 • Handle LinkedIn, resume, and coaching-related requests submitted through a ticketing system

 • Prioritize requests based on member tier and defined capacity

 • Deliver feedback and coaching within established response timelines

 • Ensure all support is documented and trackable

 • Avoid ad-hoc or off-platform support outside defined scope



6. Collaboration & Alignment

 • Attend live coaching calls to stay aligned with program direction

 • Coordinate with Community Managers on member needs and patterns

 • Share insights on recurring challenges and opportunities for improvement

 • Follow established SOPs, ethical guardrails, and scope boundaries



What This Role Is NOT

 • Not job placement or recruiting

 • Not unlimited or on-demand coaching

 • Not therapy or life coaching

 • Not done-for-you LinkedIn or resume writing

 • Does not guarantee job outcomes



Ideal Background

 • Experience in career services, career coaching, or structured career programs

 • Background in:

 • bootcamps

 • accelerators

 • upskilling programs

 • higher education career services

 • Strong understanding of LinkedIn optimization and resume best practices

 • Familiar with ATS systems and job description alignment

 • Comfortable supporting professionals in tech, IT, or career-transition spaces



Skills & Traits

 • Strong 1:1 coaching and facilitation skills

 • Clear, supportive written and verbal communication

 • High ethical judgment and strong boundary-setting

 • Organized, reliable, and systems-oriented

 • Comfortable managing volume within defined limits

 • Calm, professional presence in live and async settings



Application Process

To apply, please submit:

 1. A Loom video (5–8 minutes) that includes:

 • A brief self-introduction

 • Your experience with 1:1 coaching and career services

 • Examples of how you’ve supported LinkedIn or resume improvements

 • How you balance coaching depth with scope and ethical standards

 2. Optional (encouraged):

 • A short example of how you would coach someone through:

 • improving a LinkedIn headline, or

 • strengthening a resume bullet point



Engagement Details

 • Part-time / contract role

 • Remote

 • Coaching volume and availability tied to plan tier and capacity

 • Reports to leadership and collaborates with Community Managers

title: Beauty PR- Email Marketing Specialist
description:
Location:

Remote



About Us:

Honey Hut PR is a digital PR agency based in the UK, specialising in skincare, wellness, and beauty clients. We focus on securing high-quality media coverage for our clients and developing strong relationships with UK publications. As we continue to grow, we’re looking for a PR outreach specialist to join our team. This role is ideal for someone with a proactive mindset who enjoys contact research, database work, media outreach, and building journalist connections.



Responsibilities:



Media outreach - send approximately 10 media pitches per month, each requiring multiple
s to various contacts

Media research - identify and expand our database of UK journalists, editors, and publications

Tracking and follow-ups - monitor responses, report on progress, and ensure pitches are followed up on

Understanding client needs - tailor outreach to align with each brand’s story and PR objectives

Working independently - follow structured processes while thinking critically about the best outreach strategies



Please note: Ongoing training and support in media outreach and PR will be provided.



Requirements:



Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, with strong attention to spelling, grammar, and formatting

Ability to research and find relevant media contacts, inputting into our Excel Master Database

Self-motivated, organised, and able to work independently

Strong time management skills, ensuring outreach is completed to deadlines.

Interest in skincare, beauty, and wellness is an advantage

Experience in PR, communications, journalism, or marketing is a plus but not essential



What we offer:



All UK national holidays off with full pay

7 additional paid personal leave days per year

5 additional paid days for personal life events (including sick leave)

Log off early scheme - if outreach tasks are completed for the day, you can finish early

Ongoing training and support in media outreach and PR

Opportunity to work with global clients in the beauty and wellness industry



To apply, please do the following THREE THINGS and send everything via
 to 
 Please quote 'Beauty PR-
 Marketing Specialist' in the message subject line when applying.

2. Attach a resume.

3. Make a fresh LOOM recording of yourself for this role (no longer than 90 seconds) briefly discussing your experience relevant to the role, and then talk about yourself and your interests. Please use LOOM and do not send a video as an attachment.



If successful, you will be contacted for an interview to discuss the next steps.

title: Creative Strategist
description:
???? Who Are We?

Hey there!

We’re a fast-growing eCommerce brand group operating multiple Shopify stores and scaling aggressively across the US and Europe with high-performing Meta 
 & Instagram) ads.

We’re not an agency.

We own the brands.

That means ideas move fast, get tested with real traffic, and scale based on performance—not opinions.

We’re expanding our creative team and looking for a Senior Performance Creative Strategist to help turn attention into measurable results at scale.

???? The Role – What You’ll Own

As our Creative Strategist, you’ll own the performance creative engine of the brand.

Your focus is ads:

UGC-style, direct-response creatives

Hooks, angles, messaging, and structure

Testing, iteration, and scaling loops

You’ll work closely with media buyers, editors, and creators to ensure our creatives don’t just look good—but perform.

???? Who This Is NOT For

This role is not for you if:

You’ve never worked on high-performing paid ads for Shopify-based eCommerce brands

You’re junior or still learning the basics of Meta ads

You only write copy but don’t analyze performance data

You rely fully on others to tell you what to create

You’re uncomfortable with fast iteration, ownership, and accountability

This is a senior, performance-driven seat.

???? Who We’re Looking For

You’re a strong fit if you:

Write killer ad scripts tailored to awareness levels

Know how to guide UGC creators, influencers, and video editors

Can reverse-engineer winning ads by reading the data

Understand psychology, storytelling, and persuasion

Think in hooks, angles, retention, and iteration

Translate data into clear creative actions

Take ownership of outcomes—not just tasks

Are disciplined, fast, and process-oriented

???? What You Bring

3–5+ years experience in creative strategy & copywriting (DTC or agency)

A portfolio of high-performing Meta ads

Strong understanding of consumer psychology

Experience working with influencer content, UGC, and editing teams

Comfort managing or contributing to $300K+/month ad accounts

Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and work independently

???? Your Day-to-Day Responsibilities

Develop creative briefs aligned with product goals and audience psychology

Research competitors, analyze account performance, identify hooks & angles

Write ad copy for video, static, and carousel formats

Build storyboards and creative outlines for production

Guide influencer recordings (A-roll / B-roll) and give revision feedback

Collaborate with editors to refine execution

Analyze performance data (CTR, hold rate, CPA, ROAS)

Propose, test, and iterate new creative formats continuously

???? Why Join Us?

???? We’re brand owners your ideas go live fast

???? Creative work here directly impacts revenue

???? Remote-first, high-performance culture

???? Unlimited paid training, mentorship, and resources

???? Access to Loom libraries, templates, and AI tools

???? Paid vacation after 1 year

No bloated teams.

No endless meetings.

Just clarity, execution, and iteration.

???? Hiring Process

We move fast and respect your time:

1?? Loom video – introduce yourself and your experience

2?? Short creative task

3?? Interview & offer

???? What’s Next?

If this role resonates, choose ONE core value below and include its number in your application:

CORE VALUES

1?? Results Obsessed

2?? Attention to Detail

3?? Accelerated Excellence

4?? Relentless Ownership

5?? Prepared to Win

6?? Collaborative Innovation

7?? Never Not Growing

Apply now—and let’s build ads that actually convert. ????



Performance Creative Strategist – Pre-Screening Questions



1- How many years of professional experience do you have in creative strategy for performance marketing?

(Multiple choice)

0–1





2–3





4–5





6+



2- How many years of 

hands-on experience creating or managing Meta 
 & Instagram) ads do you have?

(Multiple choice)

0–1

2–3

4–5

6+



3- Have you owned or led a creative strategy for a performance-driven DTC brand or agency account?

(Yes / No)



4- What was the largest monthly ad spend you’ve actively worked on?

(Multiple choice)

Under $50K

$50K–$150K

$150K–$300K

$300K+



5- Which best describes your creative workflow?

(Multiple choice)



I mainly execute briefs given to me

I contribute ideas but don’t own results

I analyze performance data and proactively propose new creatives

I fully own creative testing, iteration, and scaling decisions



6- Briefly describe a winning ad or creative concept you worked on and  what data signaled it was working 

(Short answer – 3–5 sentences max)





7- Do you have prior experience advertising products in the wellness or lifestyle space?

(Yes / No)

(Optional – nice to have)





8- Which KPI do you prioritize FIRST when evaluating a new creative? Why?





Please answer all questions carefully. Short, clear, and honest answers are appreciated.

title: Virtual Assistant (QA Support) Android App Monitoring (Long-term) (No Experience or Skills Needed)
description:
Looking for 500+ Android users to help test and monitor Android app stability and connectivity across different phone and tablet brands/models while the device is online (compatibility/stability testing).



This is very simple: install the app from the Google Play Store, keep it running, and follow short testing/verification steps when requested.



What you do (simple):

- Install the app via Google Play Store (no APK/sideload)

- Keep it running in the background (You can use other apps / use device as always)

- Keep the device online as much as possible (target: 20–24h/day)

- Short weekly check-in / testing steps / reporting (to confirm stability + uptime)



Why it’s a good fit:

- No experience or special skills needed

- No calls, no meetings

- Works alongside any VA/freelance job

- Setup once ? keep running long-term

- Great for anyone who wants a low-effort side gig



Requirements:

- Android device (phone or tablet)

- Stable internet

- Phone online most of the day (target: 20–24h/day uptime)

- Reliable/consistent (uptime & response time matter)



? Please do NOT apply if:

- Your phone is only online a few hours/day

- You use airplane mode at night / regularly disconnect

- You only use iPhone/iPad



? We’re prioritizing reliable testers who can keep a device online 20–24h/day.



How to apply:

Fill out this short form (takes 2 minutes):

title: Virtual Assistant - Operations, Dispatch & Inbound Sales (Remote)
description:
About the Role:



Dean of Clean is a fast-growing cleaning company seeking a highly reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to handle inbound leads, customer communication, scheduling, dispatching, and cleaner support. This is a business-critical operations role responsible for keeping both customers and cleaning teams running smoothly day to day.



You will primarily use:

Quo – to handle customer calls and messages

Housecall Pro – to manage scheduling, jobs, and customer records

Google Local Service Ads (LSA) – where inbound leads come from









This is not a casual or flexible side gig. We are looking for someone who is consistent, dependable, calm under pressure, and able to commit to a fixed schedule.





Key Responsibilities:



Answer inbound calls and messages using Quo

Respond to and close leads from Google Local Service Ads

Convert inquiries into booked jobs (sales-focused responsibility)

Schedule and manage jobs using Housecall Pro

Dispatch and support cleaning teams during jobs (access issues, questions, timing changes, etc.)

Act as the main point of contact between customers and cleaners

Handle reschedules, issues, and day-of-job problems

Manage customer records, notes, and follow-ups

Send quotes, confirmations, and handle basic billing questions

Support daily operations and admin tasks as needed





Requirements:



Experience in call center, BPO, dispatch, customer service, or inbound sales

Experience using CRMs, scheduling, or dispatch systems (Housecall Pro, Jobber, ServiceTitan, etc. is a big plus)

Comfortable talking to customers, booking jobs, and handling issues

Strong reliability and attendance

Ability to commit to a fixed schedule

Strong English communication skills (spoken and written)

Calm under pressure and good at problem-solving

Highly organized and comfortable multitasking

Stable internet connection and quiet work environment





This role is a good fit if you:



Like being the hub of operations and solving problems

Are comfortable talking to both customers and field staff

Can stay calm when schedules change or issues come up

Take schedule commitments seriously

Want a stable, long-term role with responsibility





This role is NOT a good fit if you:



Want quiet, task-only admin work

Do not like phone calls or real-time problem solving

Need very flexible or changing hours

Often have last-minute availability issues





What We Offer:



Remote work

Stable, consistent hours

Long-term growth opportunity

Structured, professional work environment







How to Apply:



Please send your resume and a short cover letter explaining:



Your experience with customer service, dispatch, or sales roles

Your experience with CRMs, scheduling, or call systems (if any)

Your availability and ability to commit to a fixed schedule

Why reliability and consistency are strengths of yours







Send to:

title: Part-Time X (Twitter) Engagement VA
description:
Hi! I'm a solopreneur running a portfolio of profitable SaaS apps. I'm growing my personal brand on X 
) in the indie hacker / tech / building-in-public space and need someone to handle daily engagement on my account.



This is NOT content creation. I write my own tweets and threads. Your job is the engagement side — replying to big accounts, commenting on peers' posts, building community, and managing notifications.



What You'll Do:



Shift (08:30 PM - 12:30 AM PHT):



Monitor and reply to posts from a curated list of large accounts (Elon Musk, Sam Altman, etc.)



Engage with smaller accounts in our niche — thoughtful comments, likes, follows



Respond to comments on our posts



Same as above — this is the US peak hours window so this shift is critical



Check and manage DMs (respond to simple ones, flag important ones)



Log daily activity in Google Sheet



Daily targets: ~40-50 replies, 60+ likes, track everything in a shared sheet.



Requirements:



Strong written English (you'll be writing AS me — replies must sound natural, smart, and conversational)



Familiar with X/Twitter (you use it or have managed accounts before)



Can type fast and manually (NO copy-paste, ever — this is a strict rule)



Reliable internet



Comfortable using: X Pro,
, Google Sheets, Chrome Remote Desktop



Nice to have:



You know what "indie hacking" or "building in public" means



Interest in tech/startups/AI



Experience managing someone else's social media



What You Get:



Full training SOP provided — exactly what to say, what to avoid, daily playbook



Long-term role — if it works out, this grows with the account



Performance bonuses for hitting milestones



How Account Access Works:



Chrome Remote Desktop (you control my PC remotely)



You never need to share personal info or accounts

title: Meta Ads Media Buyer
description:
Meta Ads Media Buyer 
 & Instagram) Senior Level Long Term



Company: Candor Marketing

Compensation: Based on experience plus performance bonuses

Start Date: ASAP



About Candor Marketing

Candor Marketing is a growing U.S. based digital marketing agency that helps service businesses generate leads and build authority through content and paid advertising.



We are looking for a high level Meta Ads Media Buyer who can take ownership of ad accounts, think strategically, and improve performance without needing constant direction.



This is a long term role for someone who wants stability and growth with an agency over the next several years.



Who This Role Is For

You deeply understand Meta Ads and do more than boost posts.

You understand funnels, buyer psychology, and conversion strategy.

You can build, launch, optimize, and scale campaigns on your own.

You check accounts daily and actively look for ways to improve performance.

You bring ideas, tests, and recommendations without being asked.

You think like a strategist, not just someone who manages ads.



We are looking for someone who can take ownership so our team does not have to manage the ads day to day.



Responsibilities



Campaign Strategy and Setup

Build and structure Meta campaigns from scratch

Create and manage the following campaign types:

Lead generation campaigns

DM campaigns (Messenger and Instagram)

Follow and engagement campaigns

Traffic and conversion campaigns

Landing page campaigns



Build full funnel structures:

Cold audiences

Warm audiences

Retargeting campaigns

Top of funnel, middle of funnel, bottom of funnel



Set up and manage:

Meta Pixel

Conversion tracking and events

Custom audiences

Lookalike audiences

Conversions API when needed



Funnel and Conversion Optimization

Understand and optimize landing pages, lead forms, VSL funnels, and appointment funnels

Identify drop off points and recommend improvements

Work with our team to improve offers, hooks, messaging, and creative direction



Daily Optimization and Account Management

Check all active ad accounts daily

Monitor CPL, CPA, CTR, CPM, frequency, and conversion rates

Pause underperforming ads quickly

Adjust budgets and scale winning campaigns

Continuously test new audiences, creatives, angles, and campaign structures



Audits and Performance Improvement

Perform full ad account audits when needed

Identify structure issues, tracking problems, funnel bottlenecks, and scaling opportunities

Provide clear recommendations to improve performance

Continuously look for ways to increase lead volume, improve lead quality, and lower costs



Reporting and Communication

Provide weekly performance summaries

Share key wins, losses, tests being run, and next optimization steps

Communicate proactively and clearly without needing to be asked for updates



Required Experience

At least 3 years of professional Meta Ads experience

Proven results generating leads for service based businesses

Experience with DM campaigns, lead forms, and landing page conversion campaigns

Strong understanding of retargeting and full funnel strategy

Experience managing multiple ad accounts



Preferred Experience

Agency experience

Experience with GoHighLevel, ClickFunnels, or similar platforms

Experience setting up and troubleshooting Pixels and Conversions API

Ability to review ad creative and suggest improvements



What Success Looks Like

Ad accounts are checked and optimized daily

Campaigns are structured correctly without constant direction

Cost per lead improves over time

New tests and ideas are launched regularly

Our team does not need to manage or babysit the ads



Work Expectations

Full time availability preferred

Partial overlap with U.S. working hours

Reliable internet and communication

Long term mindset



Compensation

Competitive monthly salary based on experience

Performance bonuses based on results

Opportunity for long term growth and increased responsibility



How to Apply

Please include the following:



Your years of experience running Meta Ads and the types of campaigns you manage

Screenshots or case studies showing results such as CPL, CPA, or ROAS

A short Loom video (2 to 3 minutes) explaining a campaign you built, how you structured it, and how you optimized it

The word Candor at the top of your application so we know you read this



We are looking for a serious, high level media buyer who takes ownership, thinks strategically, and wants a long term role with a growing agency.

title: Creative Producer
description:
We’re looking for a Creative Producer who can own high-volume creative production for paid media across video and static formats. This role is built for someone who understands how creative directly drives performance and can ship fast, iterate faster, and scale output without losing polish.



You will produce, test, and refine creative assets for paid channels while working closely with growth and media partners. This is a hands-on production role, not a conceptual-only position. Success here is measured by volume, speed, and performance impact.



If you thrive in fast feedback loops, enjoy building systems for scale, and understand what makes paid social creative convert, this role is a strong fit.



If you enjoy building networks, managing complex relationships, and using AI creatively to scale ideas and influence, this role is a strong fit.



Why You’ll Want to Join

- You will be paid in USD (bi-monthly: every 15th and 30th)

- Up to 14 days of Paid Time Off annually (starting Day 1)

- Observance of Holidays per company guidelines

- 100% remote setup so you can work wherever you’re most productive

- Work directly with a founder operating across real estate, venture, sustainability, and culture

- High ownership role with visibility into strategy, partnerships, and long-term platform growth





What You’ll Work On

High-Volume Creative Production



- Produce 5 to 30 paid media assets per day across static and video formats

- Create ad-ready creative for Meta, TikTok, YouTube Shorts, and similar platforms

- Build fast variations testing hooks, visuals, copy, CTAs, and formats

- Maintain visual quality while prioritizing speed and iteration



Template and System Building

- Build and maintain modular Figma template systems for rapid creative iteration

- Create reusable components that allow scale without sacrificing brand integrity

- Organize asset libraries including product visuals, lifestyle assets, and brand elements



Performance-Driven Iteration

- Review performance feedback from paid media partners

- Identify patterns in winning creative and double down on what works

- Adjust creative direction based on real data, not opinions

- Stay current on paid social trends and competitor creative strategies



Direct Response Creative Support

- Write or adapt short-form copy optimized for paid media performance

- Develop hooks and headlines designed for scroll-stopping impact

- Test multiple messaging angles including education, urgency, proof, and benefits



What You Bring

- 2 to 4+ years of experience in performance creative, paid social design, or digital production

- Strong proficiency in Figma, including components, auto-layout, and batch workflows

- Experience producing high volumes of paid media creative, not just one-off assets

- Solid understanding of paid social platforms and creative testing frameworks

- Basic video editing skills using tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, or similar

- Strong eye for design with the ability to move fast without over-polishing

- Comfortable working independently with minimal oversight



Nice to Have

- Experience working with creator-led brands or media companies

- Background in performance marketing agencies or DTC brands

- Experience collaborating directly with paid media or growth teams

- Ability to analyze competitor ads and reverse-engineer winning concepts

- Familiarity with supplement, health, or consumer content categories





How to Apply

Please include:



1. Your updated resume

2. A portfolio that clearly shows high-volume creative output, including variations and iterations

3. A short 1–2 minute Loom video walking through your experience with performance creative and how you approach speed, testing, and scale



Only candidates who submit a portfolio and Loom video will be considered.



---

If you care more about shipping than polishing, understand that most creative will not win, and enjoy building systems that let you test fast and learn faster, this role offers clear ownership and real impact inside a high-performing media operation.

title: We’re Hiring: SEO Strategist (Philippines-Based)
description:
I’m Dustin, founder of Marketing Done Right, a Cleveland-based digital marketing agency. We’re on the lookout for a motivated SEO Strategist to join our Philippines-based crew and take ownership of client projects.



About Us

Marketing Done Right is a close-knit digital marketing agency that delivers top-tier Local SEO and National SEO solutions. We pride ourselves on collaboration, innovation, and helping our tea
mbers grow professionally while delivering measurable results for our clients.





Why Join Us?

Supportive Team Culture – Work with a collaborative, international team where your contributions truly matter.

Career Growth – Long-term role with opportunities to grow and advance.

Performance-Based Salary Increase – Strong results and consistent performance can lead to salary growth.

Diverse Projects – Lead SEO strategies across a variety of client accounts and industries.

Job Stability – We’re in it for the long run and are looking for someone who is, too.





Role (Overview of the Position)



This position will be responsible for leading the strategy and planning of assigned client SEO projects. The strategist will execute these strategies through MDR’s pod and support systems, working with SEO Specialists, SEO Supports, VAs, and the content team. This role involves taking clear ownership of assigned projects, ensuring strategies are aligned with client goals, guided by data, and carried through effectively from planning to delivery.



Responsibilities (Tasks Associated with the Role)



- Manage multiple client projects simultaneously while ensuring quality, focus, and on-time delivery.

- Lead the strategy and planning for assigned client SEO projects.

- Create monthly reports to show progress, highlight wins, and identify opportunities for improvement.

- Collaborate with the content team by suggesting topics and outlining content deliverables for each month.

- Work with SEO Specialists, SEO Supports, and VAs within the pod system to execute strategies effectively.

- Oversee timelines, deliverables, and workflows to ensure projects are managed smoothly from start to finish.

- Conduct audits, keyword research, and performance reviews to inform data-driven decisions.

- Provide guidance, direction, and feedback to pod members to maintain alignment and quality.

- Develop and maintain SEO documents (such as strategies, audits, and reports) for both internal use and client reporting.

- Take ownership of project outcomes, ensuring strategies stay on track and aligned with client goals.



Results (Expected Accomplishments)



- Assigned SEO projects are delivered with clear direction, steady progress, and alignment to client business objectives.

- Multiple client accounts are handled efficiently, with competing priorities balanced without delays or quality issues.

- Monthly reports consistently highlight wins, performance insights, and opportunities, equipping leadership with valuable talking points for client updates.

- Content deliverables are strategically planned, ensuring each piece contributes to improved visibility and rankings.

- Pod collaboration is seamless, with Specialists, Supports, and VAs executing tasks on time and to standard.

- Timelines, workflows, and deliverables are proactively managed, preventing bottlenecks and ensuring smooth project flow.

- Audits and keyword research regularly uncover growth opportunities, guiding smarter decision-making.

- Performance reviews lead to tangible strategy adjustments that improve traffic, rankings, or conversions.

- Leadership receives accurate, well-structured documentation that strengthens client communication and trust.

- Strategists demonstrate effective delegation and feedback, resulting in stronger team performance and accountability within pods.

- Campaigns remain adaptable to changing client needs or market conditions without losing 
ntum.

- Projects demonstrate consistent alignment with MDR’s quality standards and brand reputation.

- Workload across multiple clients is prioritized effectively, ensuring no project falls behind schedule.

- Collaboration with the content team results in deliverables that not only support SEO but also enhance overall marketing strategy.

- Client satisfaction is reinforced by clear communication, visible progress, and the strategist’s ownership of outcomes.

- Strategists show the ability to anticipate potential challenges and address them before they become roadblocks.

- Reports and strategies are presented in a way that simplifies complex data into actionable insights.

- Campaign outcomes contribute to MDR’s larger goal of delivering measurable growth and value for clients.





Requirements (Expected Proficiencies)



- Proven experience in SEO strategy, including keyword research, audits, and data-driven decision-making.

- Strong understanding of SEO best practices, local SEO, analytics, and reporting tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, etc.).

- Ability to manage and prioritize multiple client accounts at the same time without losing focus on quality or deadlines.

- Skilled in creating SEO documents for both client reporting and internal use (such as strategies, reports, and project plans) that clearly outline progress, insights, and next steps.

- Experience working closely with cross-functional teams (such as content, design, development, PPC, and virtual assistants) to ensure deliverables align with SEO strategies and client goals.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills, both written and verbal.

- Ability to think critically, stay calm under pressure, and find solutions in urgent or challenging situations.

- Comfortable giving direction, feedback, and guidance to tea
mbers to keep projects on track.

- Detail-oriented, organized, and able to keep timelines and deliverables moving smoothly.

- Familiarity with the latest SEO trends, algorithm updates, and digital marketing practices.





How to Apply

Interested applicants must fill out this Google Form to be considered:

title: Sales Person
description:
We are looking for a Sales Person who is experienced but at the same time willing to learn and listen to new sales techniques.



The company you’ll be representing is a well-established catering company based in Maryland, known for delivering exceptional culinary experiences and outstanding service. You’ll work closely with the CEO and will be trained by her on how to win deals.



Responsibilities:

++ Identify and pursue new sales opportunities through inbound leads, referrals, and outbound outreach

++ Build and maintain strong, long-term customer relationships

++ Prepare and deliver persuasive presentations and proposals

++ Bring potential customers through the sales process and close contracts to meet or exceed sales targets

++ Track and manage sales activity using CRM tools



Qualifications:

>> Proven experience in sales with a strong record of closing deals

>> Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills

>> Positive, coachable attitude and a willingness to adopt new strategies

>> Highly organized, self-motivated, and goal-driven

>> Must be available to work Eastern Time (ET) hours

title: Executive Project Manager
description:
Our client, a leading medical doctor in regenerative and functional medicine, is seeking a highly skilled Executive Project Manager to serve as the operational and strategic engine of the practice. This role is ideal for a seasoned project leader who excels at turning vision into actionable plans, managing cross-functional initiatives, and driving operational excellence in a fast-growing clinical environment.



Key Responsibilities:

Operational Leadership & Execution

Translate the doctor’s vision into clear project plans, priorities, and execution roadmaps.

Build, refine, and optimize SOPs, workflows, dashboards, and systems to support scalability and efficiency.



Project Management:

Lead and coordinate internal staff and external vendors to ensure cohesive execution.

Drive accountability by tracking deliverables, monitoring progress, and ensuring deadlines are consistently met.



Patient & Team Experience Optimization:

Ensure seamless, high-quality patient and staff experiences across all touchpoints.

Identify and proactively resolve operational bottlenecks and workflow issues.



Strategic Alignment:

Partner closely with the doctor to prioritize projects, structure timelines, and sequence initiatives.

Maintain organizational focus, alignment, and progress toward long-term goals.



Ideal Candidate:

Strong experience in executive project management, operations leadership, or project management.

Proven ability to manage complex projects and cross-functional teams.

Excellent strategic thinking, organizational skills, and execution discipline.

Systems-oriented, proactive, and skilled at building operational structure.

Thrives in dynamic, entrepreneurial, fast-paced environments.

Exceptional communication and leadership abilities.

***Preferably someone very interested in working in the medical industry. Not required but preferred



To Apply:



Use the subject line “Insanely good project manager” (required for consideration) and answer the following questions:

1. Describe your experience acting as an Executive Project Manager or operations lead. Share an example of a complex project you managed and how you ensured successful execution.

2. Describe a system, workflow, or SOP you created that improved operations.

3. Why do you believe you’re a strong fit for this Executive Project Manager role?

4. Are you okay with $5 hourly rate.

title: Customer Success Specialist for Fast-Growing E-Com Brand (Europe Focus) - Long Term
description:
Are you a problem solver who loves turning angry customers into happy fans?



We are a rapidly scaling E-commerce company operating in the Netherlands, Belgium, and Germany. We are looking for a Customer Success Specialist to join our team long-term. This is not just a "reply to
s" job. You will be the face of our brand and the guardian of our financial health.



The Role:



Multi-Lingual Support: Handling customer
s in English, Dutch, and German (using our templates and translation tools).



Dispute Management: Managing PayPal disputes and Stripe chargebacks. You must fight to win every case by submitting the correct evidence.



Order Logistics: Tracking orders, communicating with suppliers, and reassuring customers about shipping times.



Feedback Loops: Reporting product issues to the management team to improve our quality.



Who We Are Looking For:



Eloquent English: Your written English must be perfect. No robotic responses. You must sound human and empathetic.



European Market Experience: Experience supporting customers in NL, DE, or FR is a massive plus.



Tech Savvy: You know how to use Shopify, ZenDesk (or similar), and are an expert at using DeepL/ChatGPT to translate accurately.



Detail Oriented: You never miss a tracking number. You never send a template with the wrong name.



Thick Skin: You stay calm when customers are angry.



Requirements:



Fast, reliable internet (Primary + Backup connection required).



Experience with PayPal Resolution Center is highly preferred.



Available to work [Insert Your Preferred Time Block, e.g., 9 AM - 5 PM CET].



Salary: $3 - $5 USD / Hour (Depending on experience and language skills).



How to Apply: Please reply to this post with:



A link to your resume.



A screenshot of your internet speed test.



The Subject Line of your
 must be: "I am your European Support Pro - [Your Name]"



Explain this in your reply: 



1. When have you ever experienced turning an "angry" customer into a happy one, how did you do this and what did it feel like for you. 

2. If a german customer is not happy with his order and wants to open a dispute claim, how will you prevent this from happening and what tools will you use to resolve this situation?

description:

Your Resume

title: Project Coordinator with Customer Support Experience
description:
About the Client

Our client is a SaaS company offering a cloud-based ERP platform with a strong focus on financial management. Their system helps businesses streamline accounting, reporting, and core operations through an integrated, scalable solution.



About the Role

The Support & Implementation Analyst is a hybrid role responsible for both customer support and implementation delivery. This position supports customer onboarding, platform configuration, data imports, internal coordination, and training preparation while serving as a frontline responder for support tickets.



This role requires strong organization, attention to detail, and the ability to balance structured implementation work with day-to-day support.



Role Breakdown:

50% Implementation Support

50% Customer Support



Key Responsibilities:

Implementation (50%)

Support customer onboarding, platform setup, and configuration

Perform accurate data imports (clients, jobs, suppliers, financial data)

Track project milestones, risks, and deliverables; provide status updates

Prepare training materials and coordinate training schedules

Maintain implementation documentation and meeting summaries

Coordinate with Implementation, Product, Success, and Sales teams



Customer Support (50%)

Respond to and troubleshoot customer support tickets

Escalate issues and ensure timely resolution

Provide clear guidance and step-by-step assistance to customers

Identify recurring issues and improvement opportunities

Maintain knowledge base articles, LMS modules, and documentation

Submit weekly support summaries and maintain accurate CRM records



Requirements

1–3 years of experience in customer support, implementation, onboarding, or SaaS operations

Strong written communication and customer-facing skills

High attention to detail, particularly with data handling and system setup

Ability to troubleshoot independently and manage multiple tasks

Experience with CRMs, ticketing, or project tools (HubSpot, Zendesk, 
 preferred)

Strong organizational and time-management skills

Experience in SaaS, agency, or financial operations environments is a plus

Familiarity with LMS platforms, Scribe, Loom, or training workflows preferred

Basic knowledge of project management and data quality processes

title: Executive Assistant / Operations Manager
description:
Reports to: CEO

Type: Full-Time | Remote

Compensation: Up to $8/hour

Department: Executive & Operations



ROLE OVERVIEW

The Executive Assistant / Operations Manager provides direct support to the CEO while coordinating daily operational tasks across the organization. This role ensures priorities are tracked, systems stay organized, and execution moves forward across teams.



This position is ideal for a highly organized, detail-oriented professional who excels at follow-up, documentation, systems coordination, and professional communication in a remote environment.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



Executive Support

• Manage the CEO’s calendar, meetings, agendas, and task follow-ups

• Draft and organize executive communications and documents

• Capture meeting notes and track action items to completion

• Handle sensitive information with discretion and professionalism



Operations Coordination

• Track tasks, deadlines, and updates across departments

• Follow up with tea
mbers to ensure timely completion of deliverables

• Consolidate updates into clear summaries for the CEO

• Identify stalled items and escalate appropriately



Systems Administration Support (Operational)

• Coordinate system access, permissions, and offboarding as directed

• Maintain organization of project management tools and file systems

• Enforce naming conventions, documentation standards, and system hygiene

• Provide first-line operational support for tools (not IT engineering)



Negotiation & Follow-Through Support

• Support negotiations through professional outreach, follow-ups, and documentation

• Communicate confidently with vendors, partners, and stakeholders to move matters toward resolution

• Assist in closing loops on agreements, approvals, and commitments as directed by leadership



Documentation & SOP Support

• Maintain and update Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)

• Organize onboarding materials and internal documentation

• Support training libraries and process documentation



Lead Generation

• Research and collect potential leads based on given criteria

• Manage and update lead lists or CRM

• Assist with outreach and follow-ups

• Track leads and report basic results





WHAT SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE

• Tasks move forward without repeated reminders

• Systems remain organized and usable

• The CEO has visibility into priorities and progress

• Teams know what is expected and by when



QUALIFICATIONS

• 2–4+ years experience as an Executive Assistant, Operations Coordinator/Manager, or similar role

• Strong organizational and communication skills

• Comfort working with tools such as Microsoft 365, Google Workspace, ClickUp, Slack, or similar

• Confidence to follow up, negotiate details, and drive matters toward completion

• High attention to detail and strong follow-through

• Ability to work independently and take direction

title: Executive Assistant. Only for A-Players.
description:
DAP Brands is hiring an Executive Assistant for A-players only.



This is not a traditional admin role. If you’re looking for a checklist job, predictable days, or constant hand-holding, this is not for you.



We are looking for a high-performing, resourceful, and extremely organized Executive Assistant who can think independently, move fast, and take ownership of critical initiatives. You will work closely with executive leadership and be trusted with high-impact projects and confidential matters.



If you thrive in fast-paced environments, anticipate needs before they’re spoken, and take pride in being three steps ahead. Keep reading.



What You’ll Do

- Own executive support end-to-end: calendar, inbox, travel, priorities, and daily operations.

- Drive projects forward: Plan, track, execute, and follow through without being chased.

- Act as the bridge between executives, internal teams, and external partners with clarity and professionalism.

- Prepare and manage documents, reports, presentations, and sensitive information with precision.

- Run meetings: agendas, action items, follow-ups, and accountability.

- Help build and optimize workflows, systems, and processes that keep the company moving.

- Spot problems before they become problems and solve them.

- Operate with absolute discretion, sound judgment, and professionalism at all times.



Who This Role Is For

- You have 3+ years supporting senior leaders as an Executive Assistant, Chief of Staff Assistant, or similar.

- You are strong in project management and know how to keep moving parts organized and on track.

You don’t wait to be told what to do. You see gaps and fill them.

- You communicate clearly, confidently, and professionally, both written and verbal.

- You are comfortable using tools like Asana, ClickUp, Trello, CRMs, and Google Workspace / Microsoft 365.

- You handle confidential information with maturity and discretion.

- You are tech-savvy, adaptable, and quick to learn.

- You take ownership, move with urgency, and hold yourself to high standards.



Who This Role Is NOT For

- Clock-watchers

- Task-only assistants

- People who need constant direction

- Anyone uncomfortable with accountability and high expectations



How to Apply

- Apply through 
/jobs

- To be considered, you MUST type “MAVERICK” before your full name when applying.



If you are the kind of EA who adds value, takes ownership, and performs at a high level, we want to hear from you.
