title: Instagram Reels Clipper & Short-Form Editor (10+ Reels/Day)
description:
I’m looking for a fast, reliable short-form editor to create a minimum of 10 Instagram Reels per day for my personal AI + lifestyle Instagram page.



You will receive daily lifestyle clips, b-roll, workday content, gym/travel footage, and talking-head videos. Your job is to turn this into clean, aesthetic, high-retention short-form videos with strong on-screen text.



This starts with a short trial, then becomes long-term daily work if it’s a strong fit.



Responsibilities

– Edit 10+ short-form clips per day

– Add modern on-screen text (hooks, POV captions, bold statements)

– Create clean, minimal, fast-paced edits suitable for Instagram growth

– Follow my brand style and reference examples

– Deliver clips same day or next morning

– Track what performs well and keep improving

– Organise files and follow a tidy workflow



Requirements

– Experience editing TikToks/Reels/Shorts

– Fast turnaround and ability to handle high daily volume

– Strong understanding of pacing, storytelling & retention

– Skilled with text-based aesthetic edits

– Highly reliable & consistent

– Good communication and ability to take feedback



Pay Structure



Base Pay:

$1–$2 per hour

(depending on speed, quality, and experience)



Monthly Performance Bonuses:

Bonuses are based on the total combined views of the clips you edit each month.



Example bonus structure:

– + $10 bonus when monthly total views pass 100k

– + $25 bonus when monthly total views pass 250k

– + $50 bonus when monthly total views pass 500k

– + $100 bonus when monthly total views pass 1M

– + $175 bonus when monthly total views pass 2M+



Hours

Daily work — roughly 3–5 hours per day depending on speed and workflow.

title: Product Engineer (Full-Stack) — $15/hr, Long-Term
description:
Kumusta! 



You might call yourself a full-stack developer or backend engineer today. We think that role is changing fast —

and we're looking for someone who's already feeling it.



We're a small Dutch tech company building ComChamp — the central nervous system for organisations. Today

it's a CRM and Customer Journey Orchestration platform: a contact database, configurable multi-step

workflows, and multi-channel interactions — all in one system. Our clients are energy and telecom companies

in the Netherlands who use it to run everything from lead intake to proposals to service delivery, without

stitching five tools together.



Where it's going: an Agentic Communication Hub — where AI agents handle routine interactions, hand off to

humans for complex ones, and operate within the same journeys and audit trails. Same workflow, executed by a

person or an AI. That's what we're building toward.



Our team is 10 people. Our codebase is 25+ TypeScript microservices. And we're growing.



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What this role actually is

********************

We don't need someone to write code line by line. AI does that now — and we use it extensively. What we need

is someone who can think clearly about what to build, direct AI to build it, and know when it's getting it

wrong.



That means:

- You understand how systems connect — databases, APIs, queues, state management — not at the syntax

level, but at the "why is this architected this way" level

- You can look at an AI-generated solution and smell when something is off

- You can break a messy business problem into clean, executable steps

- You can explain a complex idea simply — to a teammate, to a client, to an AI

- This is a product role as much as an engineering role. You'll think about what users need, how workflows

should behave, and where the system should be smarter. Then you'll make it happen — with AI as your primary

tool.



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What you bring

*************

Must-haves:

- Strong understanding of backend systems (we use NestJS, Prisma, PostgreSQL, but we care more about

depth than specific frameworks)

- Experience working with AI coding tools — Cursor, Claude, Copilot, or similar

- Clear written and spoken English — this is non-negotiable, it's how we work

- The ability to think at the product level, not just the ticket level



Great to have:

- Experience with workflow engines, state machines, or process automation

- Familiarity with Docker, Kubernetes, RabbitMQ, Redis, or GCP

- Interest in AI agents and autonomous systems — not as hype, but as real engineering problems



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



What we offer

************

- $15/hr USD — paid reliably, every time

- Long-term contract — we're not looking for a quick project, we're building a team

- Real ownership — you'll influence what we build and how

- Small team, big ambitions — your work directly shapes the product

- Work with people who think differently about what software teams will look like



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



How to apply

***********

Don't just send a CV. Write us a short message (a few paragraphs is fine) that answers two things:



1. What's something complex that you understand really well? Could be technical, could be anything.

Explain it to us like we know nothing about it.



2. Why does this role interest you? Not a generic answer — what specifically about how we described this

made you want to respond?



We read every application. The way you write your response tells us more than your resume.



-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



We're building infrastructure for a world where AI and humans collaborate on real business operations —

where small teams operate at enterprise scale. If that excites you, we'd love to hear from you.

title: Virtual Assistant - YouTube Automation
description:
NOTE: Read the full thing before you apply.

All copy-paste applications will be rejected.



We run a six-figure YouTube media business with multiple channels across sports, movies, documentary, etc.



We're looking for a Virtual Assistant to handle basic editing & research tasks for our new channel.



Your role:

- You will be given a script and access to our AI + voiceover tools

- Use our voiceover tool to generate a voiceover of the script

- Use our AI tools to generate images based on the script and turn the voiceover into final edited video.



Salary: $20/video (voiceover + video)

Video Duration: 50-60 mins

2-3 videos/week



To apply, complete this quick trial task:

title: Senior Ecommerce Bookkeeper – End-to-End Ownership (QuickBooks Online) | Morning Schedule | Remote
description:
About Us

We are an Australian-based 7-figure ecommerce business seeking an experienced and dependable Bookkeeper to take full ownership of our bookkeeping function.



This role is for someone who understands end-to-end bookkeeping, works independently, and takes responsibility for accuracy. It is not suitable for candidates who have only handled narrow tasks such as accounts payable, accounts receivable, or data entry.



About the Role

You will be responsible for the complete bookkeeping function of the business using QuickBooks Online, within an automated ecommerce environment.



This role requires accuracy, accountability, and sound judgment. You will be trusted to maintain clean books, identify issues early, and resolve problems independently, without ongoing supervision.



Key Responsibilities

- End-to-end bookkeeping using QuickBooks Online

- Monthly reconciliations (bank accounts, credit cards, clearing accounts)

- BAS preparation

- Payroll processing

- Managing invoices and purchase orders

- Cash flow tracking and reporting

- Reviewing accounts regularly to identify and correct errors

- Ensuring accuracy and consistency across all financial records

- Working with ecommerce systems and integrations (WooCommerce)

- Improving bookkeeping and reporting processes where appropriate



What We are Looking for:

- Strong experience with QuickBooks Online or a comparable online accounting platform

- Experience supporting Australian businesses, including BAS, GST, and payroll

- Ecommerce bookkeeping experience or the ability to learn quickly

- High attention to detail and strong numerical skills

- Comfortable owning the full bookkeeping function independently

- Able to identify and resolve issues without constant guidance

- Comfortable working with automated systems and software integrations



Important

This role is not suitable for candidates who:

- Have only worked on isolated bookkeeping tasks

- Rely on others to diagnose or fix accounting issues

- Require step-by-step instructions for routine bookkeeping work



We are looking for someone who understands the broader financial picture, takes ownership of accuracy, and works proactively.



Working Hours

- 35 hours per week



Required availability:

- 7:00am – 9:00am AWST

- 3:00pm – 5:00pm AWST



Flexibility outside these windows to complete weekly hours



This role uses Time Doctor for time tracking, consistent with how our remote team operates. We focus on outcomes and accuracy, not micromanagement, and Time Doctor is used as a standard accountability and reporting tool.



What We Offer

- Stable, long-term employment

- Health insurance after six months

- Ongoing training and professional development

- Exposure to modern systems and automation

- Annual tea
etup in the Philippines

- Two weeks paid leave over Christmas and New Year, plus 13th-month pay

- Opportunity to grow into a more senior role over time



Why this role is different

You won’t be micromanaged. You’ll be trusted to:

- Own the books

- Keep things accurate

- Improve how we work

- Be part of a growing ecommerce business

- If you enjoy responsibility, learning, and building systems — this role will suit you well.



How to Apply:

Complete the initial screening form:

title: Technical Customer Support – Automotive Products (Head Units, Dash Cams, TPMS) | PHP 35–40k | with Time  Doctor
description:
About Us

We are a growing automotive eCommerce and tech company specialising in aftermarket vehicle technology, including Android head units, dash cameras, reverse cameras, TPMS, OBD-II, and related accessories.



We are looking for a Product Expert who can confidently handle customer support, technical troubleshooting, and admin work, while managing their workload with minimal supervision.



About the Role

This role combines customer service, technical support, and operational admin. You will support customers primarily via chat and
, troubleshoot product issues, and ensure all follow-ups and documentation are completed accurately and on time.



We are looking for someone who solves problems properly and does not default to refunds or returns unless absolutely necessary.



Key Responsibilities

- Handle customer inquiries via chat and

- Troubleshoot head units, cameras, TPMS, OBD-II, and related products

- Guide customers through basic wiring, installation, and setup

- Complete admin tasks with a 100% weekly completion expectation but not limited to:

     - Manage Out-of-Stock (OOS) order follow-ups

     - Review and update product pages for accuracy

     - Send initial response to customer reviews and ensure follow-ups are completed

     - Track recurring issues and work toward permanent fixes



Bonus / Priority Consideration

Applicants will be prioritised if they have:

- Experience with cars, head units, dash cams, reverse cameras, or vehicle electronics

- Hands-on installation or troubleshooting experience

- Previous technical support experience for hardware or electronics



Schedule & Work Setup

- Tuesday to Saturday, morning shift

- Full-time only (no other jobs or freelance work)

- Time tracking via Time Doctor



Pay (Read Carefully)

- PHP 35,000 – PHP 40,000 per month, depending on experience

- Fortnightly pay (every 2 weeks)



What We’re Looking For (Must-Have)

- Strong self-management and ability to work without constant follow-ups

- Good multi-tasking and prioritisation skills

- Able to stay calm and effective during high-pressure periods

- Reliable with general admin work, trackers, and follow-ups

- Tech-savvy with logical troubleshooting skills

- Clear written English and ability to explain technical concepts simply



Benefits

- 13th Month Pay

- Paid Christmas to New Year break (2 weeks)

- Free HMO upon regularisation

     - Option to add dependents (employee pays premium via salary deduction)

- Annual Team-Building Trip (Company-Paid)



APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS (IMPORTANT)

- Complete the mandatory test task:

     - Make a copy of the document

     - Answer all sections using your own words and research

     - Share the link to your completed copy in your application



Test Task Link:

title: Direct Response Video Editor & Shopify Store
description:
We’re looking for a killer Direct Response Video Editor who also knows how to build and optimize Shopify stores for conversion.



This is not a basic editing job. We want someone who understands performance, sales psychology, and e-commerce funnels.



Video Editing (Primary Role):

 • Edit direct response ads for TikTok, Meta, Reels, Shorts

 • Turn raw footage into scroll-stopping, high-CTR ads

 • Add:

 • Dynamic captions

 • Hooks in first 1–3 seconds

 • Fast pacing, pattern interrupts

 • Music, sound effects, zooms, cuts

 • Test different hooks, angles, and formats

 • Understand UGC-style ads vs branded ads



Store Building / CRO (Secondary Role):

 • Build Shopify stores from scratch or improve existing ones

 • Product page optimization (layout, copy flow, trust elements)

 • Implement upsells, bundles, and clean checkout experience

 • Ensure stores are fast, mobile-optimized, and conversion-focused



?



? Requirements

 • Proven experience with direct response video ads

 • Strong editing skills (CapCut, Premiere Pro, After Effects, etc.)

 • Understands what sells, not just what looks good

 • Shopify experience (themes, product pages, basic apps)

 • Knows basic CRO principles (social proof, urgency, clarity)

 • Fast turnaround and attention to detail

 • Reliable internet and communication



?



???? Big Plus If You:

 • Have worked with TikTok ads or Meta ads

 • Know e-commerce metrics (CTR, CVR, AOV)

 • Can suggest creative angles, not just execute

 • Have experience scaling winning creatives

 • Understand Western markets (US / Canada)

title: Looking for an Experienced Funnelish Specialist for Shopify Advertorial & Product Funnels
description:
We're looking for an experienced Funnelish specialist to build high-converting advertorial and product funnels on Shopify. We need someone with proven expertise who can deliver results.



What we're looking for:



- Extensive experience with Funnelish (must have built multiple advertorial/product funnels)

- Strong understanding of Shopify and its integration with Funnelish

- Proven track record with upsells, downsells, order bumps, and checkout optimization

- Deep knowledge of what makes advertorials convert

- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

- Strong English communication skills



To apply:



Please include 2-3 examples of funnels you've built (links preferred).

Applications without portfolio examples will not be considered.



This is ongoing work with room for growth and rate increases based on performance. If you have the expertise we're looking for, we'd love to hear from you.

title: E-mail Marketeer
description:
Email Marketing Specialist (E-commerce)



Location: Remote / Hybrid

Type: Full-time / Freelance

Industry: E-commerce / DTC



About the role



We are looking for a results-driven
 Marketing Specialist to own and scale our
 marketing channel across multiple e-commerce brands. You will be responsible for creating high-converting campaigns, building smart automation flows, and continuously optimizing performance based on data.



This role is ideal for someone who understands e-commerce psychology, conversion, and how
 fits into the full customer journey.



Responsibilities

 • Plan, create, and execute
 campaigns (promotions, launches, newsletters)

 • Build and optimize automated flows (welcome, abandoned cart, post-purchase, win-back, upsell)

 • Write compelling
 copy with a strong focus on conversion

 • Collaborate with designers on
 layouts and visuals

 • Segment audiences and personalize messaging based on behavior and data

 • A/B test subject lines, content, timing, and offers

 • Monitor and report on key metrics (open rate, CTR, conversion, revenue)

 • Ensure deliverability best practices and list hygiene

 • Align
 strategy with paid ads, funnels, and overall marketing strategy



Requirements

 • 2+ years of experience in
 marketing (e-commerce required)

 • Proven experience with tools like Klaviyo, Mailchimp, ActiveCampaign or similar

 • Strong copywriting skills in English

 • Data-driven mindset with experience analyzing campaign performance

 • Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS is a plus

 • Experience working with multiple brands or stores is a plus



What we offer

 • Competitive salary or freelance rate

 • Remote-friendly working environment

 • High ownership and direct impact on revenue

 • Opportunity to work with fast-growing e-commerce brands

 • Room for growth and long-term collaboration



How to apply



Send your CV and examples of
 campaigns or flows you’ve worked on (metrics are a big plus).

title: Experienced Creative Strategist / Creative Director
description:
Location: Remote

Company: GildedWave Limited

Employment Type: Part-time (can be extended to full-time)



About Us:

At GildedWave Limited, we’re passionate about building brands that convert. Our webshops serve a global audience with a wide variety of products, in the Health & Beauty niche. We leverage the power of Meta advertising to reach, engage, and convert customers. Now, we’re looking for a Creative Strategist/Director to bring powerful creative ideas to life that drive performance and brand love.



Job Description:

As a Creative Strategist/Director, you’ll play a critical role in conceptualizing and directing winning ad creatives for
 and Instagram. You’ll translate product benefits into sharp, engaging angles and formats, brief the design team, and guide creative testing. You understand how to craft scroll-stopping creatives and how each format fits into the customer journey — from the first touch to the final conversion.



Responsibilities:

• Develop creative concepts, hooks, and storyboards for Meta ads that drive conversions.

• Brief and collaborate with video editors, graphic designers, and copywriters.

• Research competitors and winning ads to create trend-aware strategies.

• Identify and test different ad angles and value propositions.

• Analyze performance data to iterate on what works and discard what doesn’t.

• Work closely with the Media Buyers to align creative output with campaign objectives.



Requirements:

• 3+ years of experience in a creative role, ideally in paid social or DTC e-commerce.

• Deep understanding of performance creatives for Meta (UGC, native ads, etc.).

• Strong copywriting skills and creative direction experience.

• Analytical mindset: comfortable reviewing metrics and iterating creatives based on performance.

• Experience working with creative teams or freelancers.

• English fluency, written and spoken.

• Video editing background is a plus + (not a necessity)





What We Offer:

• A creative, high-impact role within a performance-focused e-commerce company.

• Flexible remote work environment.

• Competitive salary: $8 – $18 per hour, depending on experience.

• Freedom to test bold ideas and influence creative strategy.

• An energetic team where your input matters.

title: Ecommerce Executive/Specialist (Shopee, Tiktok, Lazada Seller Center)
description:
URGENT HIRING. MUST HAVE EXPERIENCED IN ECOMMERCE



Join our team and become part of a dynamic, global organization of 40 professionals across Korea, Singapore, Malaysia, and the Philippines. Collaborate closely with our regional teams to grow an exciting portfolio of leading Korean brands, including Beauty of Joseon, Needly, Tirtir, and other top-trending names in the market.



We are seeking a confident and experienced tea
mber who can independently oversee e-commerce operations, take proactive initiative, and consistently deliver results with minimal supervision, ensuring long-term success and stability in the role.



Key Responsibilities:



- Serve as the Point-in-Charge (PIC) and technical expert for the BigSeller platform, providing system guidance, troubleshooting, and workflow optimization.

- Stay updated on BigSeller feature releases and system enhancements, implementing updates to improve operational efficiency.

- Manage product listings across multiple online platforms (Shopee, Lazada, TikTok Shop), ensuring accuracy, quality, and completeness (basic photo editing and product research).

- Monitor pricing strategies and campaign promotions (e.g., 11.11, 12.12, Payday Sales) to drive sales growth performance.

- Track and analyze sales data, competitor activity, inventory levels, and shipment status, preparing actionable performance reports.

- Confidently present weekly and monthly data to management, translating complex metrics into clear strategies.

- Maintain overall e-commerce account health, coordinating with teams to resolve customer service issues, refunds, returns, and fraud cases.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide ad-hoc support for campaigns and special projects.



Qualifications:



- 2–3 years of hands-on experience managing e-commerce operations on Shopee, Lazada, TikTok Seller Centre or Account, or similar is required.

- Strong understanding of online campaign management, pricing strategies, and platform algorithms.

- Proficient in Google sheets and Excel. Managing large datasets, utilizing advanced formulas (e.g., VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables), and generating performance reports.

- Highly organized, able to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

- Strong communication skills with the ability to work effectively in multicultural teams.

- Seeking a dedicated full-time and long term role.



Benefits:

- Stable full time employment with leave benefits, up to 14 days annual leave, public holiday leave, birthday leave.

- Travel Opportunity to Singapore based on performance.

- Comfortable work environment, same working time zone as Philippines (GMT +8).

- Structured salary increase and promotion based on performance.



To apply, please answer a few short pre-screening questions via the Google Form linked below. This helps us better understand your background and fit for the role before the interview stage.







We appreciate your interest and look forward to hearing from you!

title: Customer Experience & Operations Associate (E-commerce Coffee Company) *Full Time, Remote | Long-Term Growth Opportunity
description:
Are you ready…

To start a role that motivates and excites you?

And a position where we invest in your learning, education, and growth?



Then keep reading, we want to work with you!





WHY YOU’LL LOVE THIS POSITION:

This is not your typical support role — you’ll work directly with our founders, influence company-wide systems, and gain exposure to every part of the business.



Incredible company culture:

• Small, close team with collaborative, friendly and open culture.

• We believe the biggest asset of a company is our people. We focus on helping each tea
mber reach their full potential by investing in their learning, growth, skills, and education. When we grow as individuals, we succeed as a team.

• Not a fan of office politics or drama? We’re on the same page. Instead of wasting time with that, we focus on solving problems and reaching goals

• 100% remote, enjoy the comfort and flexibility of working from home



Pay, benefits, progression, and long-term growth:

• Competitive salary

• Benefits including up to 16 days a year Paid Time off

• Progression as we grow: greater responsibilities, leadership opportunities, and increased pay.

• Feel empowered, make decisions, have an impact

• Grow with the company and live up to your potential!

• Join an exciting, fast-growing company!







ABOUT US:

We’re a young, ambitious, and small (but growing!) company that’s making a massive impact in ecommerce. 



Since 2015 we’ve been obsessed with building award-winning products and awesome brands that people fall in love with. We have 2 primary brands in our portfolio: 

(1) an international award-winning coffee products brand 
 / 
).

(2) an educational coaching program that helps entrepreneurs grow their businesses to create a positive impact in the world!



Our two recent flagship products became the world’s most successful launches in their categories. We’ve shipped more than 200,000 orders worldwide and we’re continuing to expand.



Our culture is transparent and candid. You’re always welcome (and encouraged!) to ask questions or express a difference of opinion. Learning and growth is a cornerstone of our culture, both personally and professionally. We work hard, and we have fun!







WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

We’re looking for a proactive and detail-oriented team player to fill this role—someone who thrives on solving problems, staying organized, and making things run smoothly across departments.



Do you love helping customers, supporting a team, and keeping operations organized? Do you get satisfaction from making systems work better and “getting things done”? If yes, we want you on our team!



You’re probably the type of person who:

• Enjoys supporting others and finding solutions to problems

• Has strong communication and organizational skills

• Likes working behind the scenes to make sure everything runs like clockwork

• Is excited to wear multiple hats and be part of a growing, fast-moving company

• Has worked directly with founders or in a startup, and enjoys that fast-paced, flexible vibe

We’re not just looking for someone who can support our team, we’re looking for someone to be proactive with taking ownership of tasks, solve problems independently, and grow into larger responsibilities over time.







YOUR OPPORTUNITY AND ROLE ON THE TEAM:

Our culture is collaborative, friendly, and open. We hire people who are smart, ambitious, and have a strong desire to learn and grow.



Sound like you? This is an exciting long-term opportunity!



This is a fully remote position. You’ll work directly with our founders and collaborate with our small but mighty team to support customer happiness, streamline operations, and take on projects that help the business grow. 



This is a foundational role — one where you’ll gain visibility into all parts of the company.



As you grow, your role will grow with you, based on your interests and strengths:

• Want to work improving our systems and processes? Awesome!

• Have ideas on how to improve our website? Fantastic!

• Want to learn how to manage projects? Let’s go!



We’re not just hiring for a role — we’re hiring for potential. 



Your responsibilities will span 4 key areas: customer experience (30-40%), operations/logistics (20-30%), executive support (10-20%), and special projects (10-20%) — giving you exposure across the business. These percentages are estimates and you can expect your day-to-day to shift and evolve as the business grows and as you take ownership. 



1. Customer Experience

• Provide
/chat-based support for our customers across our channels (Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale)

• Answer order and product questions, resolve issues promptly, and ensure customers feel heard and supported

• Support wholesale partners with order updates, invoicing, and coordination



2. Order Management & Platform Coordination

• Manage, monitor, and troubleshoot orders across Shopify, Amazon, and wholesale channels

• Troubleshoot and resolve shipping or fulfillment issues with partners and customers

• Maintain accurate product listings, inventory data, and logistics information across platforms



3. Executive & Admin Support

• Manage founder and team inboxes, schedule meetings, and organize internal documentation

• Assist with travel bookings, meeting preparation, and note-taking

• Support small projects by tracking timelines, managing tasks, and ensuring follow-through



4. Special Projects & Company Operations

• Conduct research projects to support decision-making (tools, systems, competitors)

• Support lead generation efforts through identifying new wholesale prospects, brand partners, or influencers

• Support planning and execution of events, expos, or marketing campaigns — manage timelines, logistics, and tasks

• Document and maintain SOPs for operational clarity and training

• Test and troubleshoot web pages, workflows, or customer journeys to ensure quality and functionality

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

• Take ownership of ad hoc “figure it out” tasks — we’ll guide you, but we value initiative and independent problem-solving mindset



You’ll be trained on all platforms and tools, and we’ll support your learning — but we’re looking for someone who’s excited to take initiative and build systems along the way. This role evolves — as you grow, so will your responsibilities.







ABOUT YOU / REQUIRED SKILLS OR EXPERIENCE:

We value curiosity, reliability, and the ability to take ownership. If you enjoy figuring things out, learning on the job, and taking initiative, you’ll thrive here. This role is not a fit if you need constant direction or struggle to manage your own time.



Must have experience:

• 2+ years of experience in a customer service or operations support role 
/chat-based)

• 1+ years experience in eCommerce environments (Shopify, Amazon, etc.)

• Fluent in written and spoken English



Key traits:

• Strong detail orientation, organizational, and time-management skills — you’re detail-obsessed and on top of things

• Proactive problem-solver — you take initiative, do the research, and follow through

• Able to work independently, ask questions when needed, and communicate clearly

• Comfortable with constructive feedback and direct, respectful communication



Optional but a big plus:

• Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus

• Experience with executive assistant work 
/calendar/travel management)

• Experience improving or documenting processes (SOPs)

• Experience at a startup or small business where you wore multiple hats

• “Experience coordinating projects, events, or marketing campaigns is a plus”







PAY, WORKING HOURS, HOW TO APPLY

If this description seems like it’s too intimidating for you, this position is probably not for you. However, if you’re still here reading and this sounds exciting for you, we’d love to meet you!



The full time monthly salary will be $
based on your skills and level of relevant experience. Being a member of our team has other benefits including up to 16 days of paid time off per year.



We understand you may have a busy schedule, so we’ve made our interview process extremely quick and efficient. 



To apply, please follow the steps below:

1. Get started with a quick Initial Screening here for us to get to know you: 

2. Complete the screening and we’ll be in touch with next steps once we receive it.





The position is on a first come first review basis, so the sooner you complete the screening, the more likely you'll get hired.



Good luck, and we hope to have someone awesome like you to join us!

title: Creative Photo & Video Editor for Social Media Ads (Experience Required)
description:
CarMe is a fast-growing e-commerce company and one of the market leaders in the Netherlands and Belgium in the automotive accessories industry. Our mission is simple: make driving smarter and more enjoyable with innovative products.



We are looking for a Creative Photo & Video Editor with proven experience in creating high-performing ad creatives for social media (primarily Meta). If you know how to grab attention in the first 3 seconds of a video, design scroll-stopping photo ads, and also create engaging organic posts, then this could be the perfect opportunity for you.



What you’ll be doing

- Creating photo ads and video creatives for paid social campaigns (Meta as the main focus)

- Editing UGC and raw footage into polished, high-converting ads

- Designing engaging content for organic social posts (Instagram, TikTok,
)

- Testing and iterating different creative styles to find what works best

- Ensuring all creatives align with CarMe’s brand identity and premium feel

- Staying up to date with trends in social media advertising and applying them to new content



What we’re looking for

- Proven experience in photo editing and video editing for social media ads

- Understanding of ad creative best practices (especially Meta/Facebook Ads)

- Creative mindset with an eye for detail and storytelling

- Ability to work independently and deliver on deadlines

- Strong communication skills in English

- Experience with e-commerce brands



What we offer

- Remote position with flexible working hours

- Competitive salary with room to grow as the company expands internationally

- Work with a passionate and supportive team that values creativity

- The chance to directly impact the growth of a leading automotive accessory brand



Ready to join us?

If this sounds like the right fit for you, please send us your portfolio (photo ads & video work), your CV, and a short motivation. To make sure you’ve read the full job post, please include the word “watermelon” in your application.

title: 5–10 Year Career Path With Real Ownership RIGHT-HAND OPERATOR  AI POWER USER MARKETS INSIDER
description:
5–10 Year Career Path With Real Ownership



This role is designed for someone who wants to build, not bounce.



RIGHT-HAND OPERATOR — AI POWER USER — MARKETS INSIDER



Stocks | Forex | Crypto | Systems | Execution



This is a long-term, career-defining role for one exceptional individual.



We are not in a rush.

We are not filling a gap.

This position exists because the business is expanding — not because it needs saving.



If selected, you will become the right hand to a founder operating in markets, capital, automation, and media — with a 5–10 year horizon and meaningful upside.



?? READ THIS FIRST (IMPORTANT)



This role is not for:



General VAs



Task-takers



People “interested” in markets



People learning AI



People seeking short-term work



This role is for:



Someone who lives and breathes stocks, forex, or crypto



Someone who thinks in systems, leverage, and outcomes



Someone who uses AI as a daily operating system



Someone who wants to grow with a business, not hop jobs



If that’s not you, do not apply.



???? THE NON-NEGOTIABLE CORE



You must genuinely love markets.



This means:



You follow price, liquidity, narratives, macro, sentiment



You understand how traders think and talk



You are comfortable curating, summarizing, and discussing:



Stocks



Forex



Crypto



You can speak to this audience without pretending



This is paramount. Skills can be refined. Market obsession cannot be taught.



???? AI COMPETENCY (EXTREMELY HIGH BAR)



AI is not a tool here. It is infrastructure.



You must already be:



Highly fluent with ChatGPT



Comfortable with Claude and/or Gemini



Using AI daily for:



SOP creation



Content drafting and repurposing



Summaries and synthesis



Project planning



Internal documentation



You should think of AI as a co-worker, not a novelty.



????? YOUR ROLE (HIGH-LEVEL)



You will function as an Ops-First Right Hand, owning execution across:



Calendar & priority management



Project management and delivery



SOP creation and optimization



Social media operations (execution, not strategy)



Content curation and scheduling



Inbox and communication triage



Light GoHighLevel work (“GHL-lite”)



Coordination with specialists when needed



Your job is to make sure everything happens cleanly, on time, and without friction.



???? SOCIAL + CANVA (EXECUTIONAL)



You are expected to be:



Comfortable using Canva daily



Able to create clean, on-brand:



Quote graphics



Carousels



Thumbnails



Simple video covers



Confident managing posting and scheduling workflows



This is executional excellence, not influencer creativity.



???? COMPENSATION & LONG-TERM UPSIDE

???? Salary



$1,000/month during training



Scales up to $4,500/month based on:



Performance



Ownership



KPIs



Scope expansion



We are flexible on final compensation for the right person.



????? Annual Equipment Bonus



$2,000+ per year for computer / tech upgrades



???? Benefits (Philippines)



SSS



Health benefits



Stable, long-term employment



???? Long-Term Wealth Upside (SERIOUS)



This role includes long-term participation, not just salary.



After 5 years, the position may carry:



Up to $1,000,000 in stock, equity, and tokens



This is a 5–10 year seat



In the event of:



Company sale, or



Founder retirement



You will have the option (not obligation) to continue with the next phase or leadership — entirely your choice.



This is about building something meaningful, not extracting short-term income.



???? WHO WINS THIS ROLE



You are:



Extremely organized



Calm under pressure



Obsessed with clarity



Comfortable with authority and standards



Proactive without being chaotic



Loyal to missions, not titles



You want:



Stability



Growth



Proximity to decision-making



A future, not a gig



???? THE SELECTION PROCESS



Only shortlisted candidates will be invited to a paid skills test, including:



AI-based SOP creation



Market-related content curation



Project structuring



Communication clarity



We are selecting one person.

We will wait for excellence.



FINAL NOTE



This role is not urgent.

It is important.



If you are exceptional, you will recognize this opportunity immediately.



If you are not, you will self-select out.

title: Advertising Coordinator
description:
About Us

Lucyd is a US-based advertising agency that helps conscious wellness brands grow — from cannabis to adaptogens and other functional health products. Our mission is to reduce human suffering and enhance human potential through Conscious Compounds™.



We are looking for an experienced Account Manager / Advertising Coordinator to support our DTC eCommerce advertising clients. Add the word "kettleball" on your subject line to let us know you read the whole post. 



Who We’re Looking For

You are organized, detail-oriented, and comfortable managing multiple tasks at once. You enjoy coordinating between teams, keeping projects on track, and communicating clearly with clients.



Ideal Candidate Skills:

Proficient in project management tools (ClickUp, Asana, Notion, etc.)

Proficient in creating documents, SOPs, and workflows

Able to handle high volumes of tasks and system inputs

Fast learner with strong attention to detail

Team player who collaborates well with others

Able to manage multiple priorities accurately



Mandatory Requirements

Available to work Monday–Friday, EST hours

2+ years of relevant work experience

Experience with DTC eCommerce

Experience working in an agency environment

Advanced written and spoken English



Role Overview

As an Advertising Coordinator, you will help manage advertising campaigns, support project coordination, and assist with both internal team tasks and client communication. You will work closely with Growth Strategists, Media Buyers, and Ad Designers to ensure campaigns run smoothly.



Responsibilities

Monitor and stay updated on client advertising campaigns

Coordinate projects between clients (investors) and the internal team

Ensure deliverables, timelines, and workloads are followed

Communicate campaign performance updates to clients proactively

Identify blockers and work with internal or external resources to resolve them

Support the team with advertising-related tasks (e.g., basic ad copy support)



Administrative & Coordination Tasks:

Schedule and manage biweekly client calls (agenda + recap)

Schedule ad-hoc client calls as needed

Prepare monthly ad spend and revenue reports

Perform compliance checks on live ads and landing pages

Review compliance for new ads before launch

Handle live chat account issues

Set up backup ad accounts and pages when required



What Success Looks Like

You help solve problems before they become issues. You communicate clearly, keep clients calm and informed, and help your pod stay focused on results. You are the glue that keeps projects moving and teams aligned.

title: PR Manager
description:
Position Summary

We are seeking an experienced and proactive Public Relations (PR) Manager to lead our firm's media and public relations efforts. This role plays a key part in enhancing brand reputation, increasing public visibility, and supporting our attorneys and leadership team with speaking, press, and media opportunities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in PR strategy, event coordination, and media outreach—ideally within a legal or professional services environment.



Key Responsibilities

Media & Thought Leadership

Source and secure high-impact opportunities for podcasts, webinars, speaking engagements, and interviews

Prepare briefing documents, talking points, and bios for firm representatives

Maintain and grow relationships with podcast hosts, media contacts, and event organizers

Conference & Event Participation

Identify relevant industry conferences and speaking opportunities

Coordinate logistics for firm participation, including registration, booth materials, and scheduling

Collaborate with graphic designers to develop and print handouts, pamphlets, and branded materials

Press & Publicity

Write, coordinate, and distribute press releases for firm milestones, events, and campaigns

Maintain media lists and track PR placements

Act as a point of contact for press inquiries and media opportunities

Testimonial Collection & Promotion

Collect written and video testimonials from clients across all brands

Collaborate with the content team to ensure testimonials are edited and published appropriately

Ensure all testimonials adhere to legal marketing guidelines and ethical standards



Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Public Relations, Communications, Marketing, or a related field

3–5 years of public relations experience, preferably in a law firm or professional services environment

Strong writing and editing skills for press materials, pitches, and media correspondence

Excellent organizational and project management abilities

Confidence in communicating with attorneys, leadership, and media professionals

Experience with PR software, press release distribution tools, and basic analytics/reporting platforms

Familiarity with ethical marketing standards, especially in the legal industry, is a plus



What We Offer

Competitive salary and performance bonuses

A collaborative, mission-driven work environment

Opportunities for professional development and career growth

title: Social Media Assistant *Superstar Only*
description:
Job Title: Social Media Assistant (YouTube Focus)



About the Role

A Social Media Assistant supports 11LUX’s YouTube content operations by handling daily posting, basic content creation, optimization, analytics tracking, and community management. This role focuses on execution, consistency, and performance support to help drive views, engagement, and subscriber growth.



You help ensure content is published on time, optimized correctly, and supported by data-driven insights.



Job Responsibilities

As a Social Media Assistant, you will support daily YouTube operations and content growth.

More specifically, you’ll get to:

• Content Posting & Creation

Post 3 YouTube Shorts per day (content provided). After training, edit and publish 1 video per day using provided assets. Create weekly community posts. Posting may increase during launch weeks.

• Research & Optimization

Research YouTube updates, short-form trends, and editing styles. Optimize titles, captions, tags, descriptions, and metadata. Refine and proofread AI-generated captions and titles.

• Growth & Strategy Support

Assist with strategies to improve views, engagement, and subscribers. Identify underperforming content and suggest optimizations.

• Analytics & Reporting

Perform weekly performance reviews and assist with monthly end-of-month (EOM) reports. Track uploads and performance data consistently.

• Community Management & Compliance

Respond to comments daily. Monitor content for copyright issues, platform compliance, and errors.



Job Qualifications

• Experience managing or assisting with YouTube or social media accounts

• Basic understanding of YouTube optimization and short-form content

• Strong attention to detail and ability to follow instructions

• Willingness to learn, adapt, and stay updated on platform trends

• Ability to work independently and meet daily posting requirements



Results (What Success Looks Like)

A successful Social Media Assistant will deliver:

• Consistent daily posting and content output

• Properly optimized uploads

• Organized tracking of content and performance

• Improved engagement and steady channel growth support



Requirements for Effective Remote Work

• Reliable computer or laptop capable of photo and video editing

• Stable high-speed internet connection

• Conducive work environment



Working Schedule

• Full-time opportunity

• Remote work setup (Philippines-based applicants only)

• Preferred availability starting 7:00 AM EST onwards



Benefits

• Competitive pay

• Training and growth opportunities

• Opportunity to work with a fast-growing content-driven company

title: Business Formation Virtual Assistant (Fundability & Compliance Focus)
description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and highly reliable Business Formation Virtual Assistant based in the Philippines to support the setup, structuring, and compliance of U.S.-based businesses. This role focuses on ensuring businesses are properly formed, compliant, and positioned to be bankable and funding-ready.



This is a specialized role, not general administrative support. Training and SOPs will be provided, but prior exposure to business documentation, compliance tasks, or legal/financial support is strongly preferred.



Key Responsibilities

 • Assist with U.S. LLC and Corporation formation (step-by-step guidance provided)

 • Prepare and organize EINs, operating agreements, and formation documents

 • Execute fundability checklists (business address, phone,
, NAICS, licensing, etc.)

 • Support business banking readiness (documentation preparation only)

 • Track annual reports, renewals, and compliance deadlines

 • Maintain organized, lender-ready digital records

 • Follow SOPs precisely and flag missing or incorrect information



Required Qualifications

 • Experience as a Virtual Assistant, Legal VA, or Admin VA

 • Strong attention to detail and document organization

 • Ability to follow structured processes and checklists

 • Comfortable working with U.S.-based business documentation

 • Reliable internet, consistent availability, and strong communication skills



Preferred (Nice to Have)

 • Experience supporting U.S. businesses

 • Familiarity with LLCs, EINs, or compliance tasks

 • Exposure to bookkeeping, legal support, or business admin work

 • Experience using Google Workspace, Notion, or project trackers



Work Details

 • Hours: Part-time to start (scalable)

 • Schedule: Flexible, with some overlap with U.S. business hours preferred

 • Compensation: Competitive PH-based hourly rate (based on experience)

 • Contract Type: Long-term, performance-based growth opportunity



What Success Looks Like

 • Business entities are set up correctly and on time

 • Documentation is accurate, complete, and well-organized

 • No missed deadlines or compliance gaps

 • Tasks are completed with minimal supervision

title: Full-Time Outreach & CRM Operator (Remote)
description:
Long-term | Independent Contractor | AU / NZ Market



Please read carefully. This is a structured operations role, not a generic VA job.



ABOUT THE ROLE



We run a highly structured outreach and dealflow system for MSP / IT services business owners in Australia and New Zealand.



This is not cold calling.

This is not sales pitching.

This is not random DM work.



Your job is to execute a proven outreach system exactly as designed, keep the CRM clean, and ensure every response is captured with the correct intent and next contact date.



If you like clear rules, checklists, daily targets, and accountability, you’ll do very well here.



---

What You Will Be Doing (Daily Work)



You will own one end-to-end execution role, including:



1. Market Coverage & Data Work

 • Find new MSP / IT services businesses (postcode by postcode)

 • Use Google Maps scraping tools, 
, and ZoomInfo

 • Clean, deduplicate, and enrich company + owner records

 • Prepare new contacts for next month’s
 outreach

 You will NOT send
s daily —
s only go out on the first business day of each month



2. Outreach Execution (No Pitching)

 • Send LinkedIn connection requests (daily)

 • Send LinkedIn DMs using pre-written scripts

 • Follow exact timing rules (no guessing, no improvising)

 • Withdraw unaccepted connections after 7 days



3. Response Handling (Most Important Part)

 • Process all replies 
, LinkedIn, calls, SMS)

 • For every reply, you must:

 • Identify the primary intent (sell / merge / invest / buy / back / unknown / nothing)

 • Capture a specific next contact date

 • Update the CRM correctly



4. Escalation & Recycling

 • Load non-responders into an AI calling agent

 • Track call attempts and outcomes

 • Send one final SMS when required

 • Recycle contacts correctly (6 or 12 months depending on outcome)



___

Tools You Will Use

 • 
 (CRM &
 enrolment)

 • ZoomInfo (data enrichment)

 • LinkedIn (connections & DMs)

 • Google Maps scraping tools (training provided)

 • Simple checklists and SOPs (provided)



___

Daily Activity Expectations (Non-Negotiable)



A normal 7.5–8 hour day looks like:

 • 200–300 records processed (data / cleanup / enrichment)

 • 50–80 LinkedIn connection requests sent

 • 30–50 LinkedIn DMs handled

 • 100% of replies processed the same day

 • Zero replies left without:

 • Intent

 • Next contact date



If activity is high but results are low, that’s OK.

If activity is low, that’s a problem.



___

Who This Role Is For



You will do well if you:

 • Follow systems and instructions precisely

 • Like structured, repeatable work

 • Are detail-oriented with CRM data

 • Communicate clearly in written English

 • Want a stable, long-term role, not gig work

 • Are comfortable being measured on activity and accuracy



___

Who This Role Is NOT For



Please do NOT apply if you:

 • Prefer creative or unstructured work

 • Want to “freestyle” messages

 • Dislike CRMs or admin work

 • Are looking for part-time or short-term gigs

 • Need constant supervision



___

Hours & Engagement

 • Full-time (40 hours/week)

 • Remote (Philippines)

 • Independent contractor

 • Long-term role (this is not a trial VA job)



___

Compensation

 • Competitive monthly rate (USD)

 • Paid monthly

 • Performance increases over time for strong operators



___

How to Apply (Important)



When you apply, include:

 1. A short paragraph explaining why this role suits you

 2. Your experience with CRM systems (any CRM is fine)

 3. Your experience with LinkedIn outreach or research work

 4. The word “SYSTEMS” somewhere in your application

(Applications without this will be ignored)



Shortlisted candidates will be given a paid test task.



___

Final Note



This role is for someone who wants to own a process, not just complete tasks.



If you’re looking for a place where:

 • expectations are clear

 • rules are fixed

 • good work is recognised



you’ll feel very comfortable here.

title: Virtual Accountant / Bookkeeper – UK CIS (Construction Industry Scheme)
description:
Follow the application instructions below.



About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering the best value property maintenance has established us as a reliable partner for residential and commercial clients nationwide. With decades of experience, including 50 years of expertise in garage conversions, we pride ourselves on impeccable craftsmanship, turning our clients' visions into reality while ensuring their properties remain in top condition.



Role Overview



We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accounting Virtual Assistant to join our dynamic team. This role focuses on comprehensive financial management and accounting support, including UK-specific compliance requirements. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, managing accounts payable and receivable, ensuring regulatory compliance, and providing essential financial reporting to support our expanding operations across Ireland and the UK.



Key Responsibilities

Bookkeeping & Financial Data Management



Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for all business transactions

Data Entry: Process and record financial data with precision and attention to detail

Invoice Management: Handle invoicing processes and payment processing for clients and suppliers

Account Reconciliation: Reconcile bank statements and maintain accurate account balances

Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using accounting software including MYOB



Accounts Management



Accounts Payable: Manage supplier payments, vendor invoices, and payment scheduling

Accounts Receivable: Monitor client payments, follow up on outstanding invoices, and manage debt collection

Cash Flow Management: Track and report on cash flow positions and payment cycles

Credit Control: Implement credit control procedures and manage customer payment terms



UK Compliance & Regulatory Requirements



CIS Compliance: Manage Construction Industry Scheme (CIS) compliance and monthly reporting

VAT Returns: Prepare and submit VAT returns ensuring full compliance with HMRC requirements

Tax Compliance: Maintain compliance with all UK tax regulations and submission deadlines

HMRC Submissions: Handle various HMRC submissions and correspondence



Payroll & Employment Administration



Payroll Management: Process PAYE (Pay As You Earn) and CIS payroll for employees and subcontractors

Employment Records: Maintain accurate employment records and statutory documentation

Pension Administration: Support workplace pension scheme administration and compliance

Statutory Payments: Calculate and process statutory sick pay, maternity pay, and other employment-related payments



Financial Reporting & Analysis



P&L Preparation: Generate comprehensive Profit & Loss statements and financial reports

Financial Analysis: Provide financial analysis and insights to support business decision-making

Management Reporting: Prepare regular financial reports for management review

Budget Support: Assist with budget preparation and variance analysis



Tax Preparation & Professional Support



Tax Preparation: Prepare and organize documentation for annual tax returns and submissions

Professional Liaison: Work closely with external accountants and tax advisors

Audit Support: Provide documentation and support during audits and financial reviews

Compliance Monitoring: Ensure all financial practices meet regulatory standards



Required Skills & Experience

Essential Qualifications



UK Tax Knowledge: Strong understanding of UK tax system, VAT, CIS, and PAYE regulations

Construction Industry: Experience with construction industry accounting and CIS compliance preferred

Compliance Expertise: Knowledge of HMRC requirements and submission processes

Accounting Software: Proficiency in accounting software (Sage, Xero, QuickBooks, MYOB or similar platforms)



Instructions

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

title: Graphic Designer for Australian Market
description:
Salon Marketing Solutions is an Australian-based marketing education company supporting beauty salons, skin clinics, and aesthetic businesses across Australia and New Zealand. We provide done-for-you campaigns, strategic mentoring, and practical tools to help clinic owners grow consistently and confidently.



We are looking for a talented Graphic Designer who enjoys creating beautiful, on-brand visuals and assisting with social media content production.



NOTE: This role is for professionally trained Graphic Designers only. Applicants must have formal training or proven professional experience in graphic design. This position is not suitable for individuals who only create basic designs using Canva templates or who do not have a strong understanding of design principles such as typography, layout, color theory, and branding.



This role is ideal for someone who loves graphic design and wants to build experience in social media content creation without needing to manage full social media strategy. You will work directly with the business owner and marketing team to support the relaunch and rebrand of our online course.



Professional branding guidelines, photography, and videography will be supplied. You will be given clear content pillars and direction, with room to contribute creative ideas. Your main focus will be on designing graphics and visual content, with light involvement in posting and content scheduling.



Key Responsibilities:



Design graphics, carousels, thumbnails, and branded templates using Canva or Adobe Photoshop.

Edit short-form videos (Reels/TikToks/Shorts) using CapCut or Adobe Premiere Pro (basic editing only).

Assist in preparing monthly content calendars based on provided campaigns and direction.

Support the creation of captions and basic hashtag selection (copy will be reviewed and approved before posting).

Upload and schedule posts across IG, TikTok, FB, and YouTube Shorts using the same content in different formats.

Maintain visual consistency and follow brand guidelines across all platforms.

Research competitor designs and social media trends for visual inspiration.



Must-Have Skills & Experience:



Experience or strong interest in graphic design for digital content.

Basic experience supporting social media content (posting or scheduling is a plus, not required at expert level).

Proficiency in Canva and CapCut (Adobe tools are a bonus).

Good eye for branding, layout, and visual storytelling.

Organised and reliable with the ability to meet deadlines.

Willingness to learn and take creative direction.

Warm and professional communication style.

Comfortable working with content related to men’s health (training and guidance provided).



Important Notes:



This is a remote role. You must have reliable internet and be responsive during agreed working hours.

Attention to detail is important when following brand guidelines and templates.

This is a long-term role for someone who wants to grow as a designer and content creator.

All content will be reviewed and approved by the business owner prior to posting.

You should be comfortable working with content related to men’s sexual health topics.



What’s in it for you?



250 AUD/week during probation

270 AUD/week after 3–6 months

300 AUD/week after 6–12 months

Work remotely with flexible hours (20 hours per week)

Stable, long-term opportunity with an Australian company

Clear pay progression and career growth pathway

Performance-based bonuses and annual leave (after Year 1)



Click here to APPLY:
