title: CRM & Automation Specialist (Clubworx + GoHighLevel)
description:
CRM & Automation Specialist (Clubworx + GoHighLevel)



 Part-time (flexible, with potential to grow)

Fitness / Martial Arts / Membership Business



About the Role



We are looking for a systems-driven CRM & Automation Specialist to manage, clean, and optimise both Clubworx and GoHighLevel (GHL) for our Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu academy.



Your role will be to turn two powerful but currently under-utilised platforms into one clean, connected system that supports lead management, memberships, attendance tracking, and long-term scaling.



This role is not just data entry — it is about building structure, automations, and clarity across both CRMs.



Key Responsibilities



CRM Cleanup & Data Integrity



* Audit, clean, and organise existing data in Clubworx and GHL

* Merge or remove duplicate and incomplete records

* Standardise naming conventions, tags, pipelines, and custom fields

* Ensure accurate syncing of leads and members between platforms



CRM Integration & Optimisation



* Set up and manage workflows between GHL and Clubworx

* Ensure leads flow correctly from GHL into Clubworx

* Align lead stages, trial bookings, memberships, and attendance

* Optimise each platform for what it does best:



  GHL:  lead management, follow-ups, automations, communication

  Clubworx:  memberships, attendance, class bookings, retention



Automation & Workflows



* Build automations for:



  * Lead follow-up and reminders

  * Trial class bookings and confirmations

  * Member onboarding and retention communications

  * Missed class and re-engagement workflows

* Reduce manual admin through smart automation



Attendance, Booking & App Readiness



* Optimise class booking and attendance tracking in Clubworx

* Prepare systems for future **member self-booking via app**

* Ensure attendance data can be tracked and reported accurately



Reporting & Scaling Systems



* Create dashboards and reports for:



  * Leads and conversions

  * Active members and churn

  * Attendance and engagement

* Design systems that can scale to multiple locations

* Document SOPs for CRM and automation workflows



---



Required Skills & Experience



* Strong experience with **CRMs and automation platforms**

* Experience working with **GoHighLevel (GHL)**

* Comfortable cleaning and restructuring messy CRM data

* Ability to design workflows and automations

* Strong attention to detail and process-driven mindset

* Clear written communication and documentation skills



Highly Desirable



* Experience with Clubworx or other gym CRMs (Mindbody, Glofox, Zen Planner)

* Experience with Zapier or native integrations

* Experience with membership-based or fitness businesses

* Understanding of attendance tracking and retention metrics



---



What Success Looks Like



* Clean, accurate, and connected data across both systems

* Automated lead and member workflows that reduce admin workload

* Clear visibility into sales, attendance, and retention

* Systems ready for scaling and app-based member booking



---



How to Apply



Please include:



* Your experience with **GHL and other CRMs**

* An example of a CRM cleanup or automation project you’ve worked on

* Any experience integrating multiple systems

* “Describe how you would structure GHL and Clubworx to work together for a gym.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
Job Summary

We are looking for a Marketing Data Analyst to own marketing, sales, and revenue data reporting and insights. This role is not focused on advanced machine learning or academic data science. Instead, it is about transforming fragmented marketing and sales data into clear, reliable insights that leadership can use to make informed decisions.

You will design, implement, and maintain a scalable data setup that supports growth, ensures data accuracy, and keeps reporting simple, fast, and understandable as the business evolves.



Key Responsibilities



Data Architecture & Warehousing

* Design and maintain a central source of truth for marketing and revenue data, including leads, applications, booked calls, sales (initial and recurring), and funnel events

* D
 where raw and processed data lives (e.g., BigQuery, Snowflake, Postgres, or similar)

* Ensure historical and live data integrate cleanly

* Manage schema changes caused by new tools, updated exports, or evolving business needs

* Maintain data consistency, accuracy, and long-term reliability



Marketing, Sales & Revenue Analytics

* Build and maintain reporting for funnel conversion rates (lead to application to call to sale)

* Analyze sales representative performance and call conversion rates

* Implement and maintain revenue attribution models (first-click, last-click, blended)

* Track key growth metrics such as LTV, CAC, AOV, churn, and cohort performance

* Monitor subscription and course metrics including renewals, cancellations, and billing cycles

* Translate funnel and revenue data into clear, actionable business insights



BI & Reporting

* Build dashboards used by leadership on a weekly and monthly basis

* Select and manage the BI tool (e.g., Looker Studio, Metabase, Power BI, Tableau)

* Keep reporting simple, fast, and trustworthy

* Prevent spreadsheet sprawl and fragile reporting logic



Integrations & Automation

* Design and manage data flows from marketing, sales, and revenue tools

* Integrate platforms such as CRM, checkout, scheduling, and advertising tools

* Use native connectors, APIs, automation tools, or scheduled imports to move data

* Reduce manual data handling and ongoing maintenance



Mandatory Skills

* Strong SQL skills, including joins, aggregations, and window functions

* Experience working with modern data warehouses

* Hands-on experience with BI and dashboarding tools

* Solid understanding of marketing funnels, attribution, subscription revenue, churn, and cohort analysis

* Ability to own marketing and revenue data end-to-end

* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders



Preferred Skills

* Experience with marketing, CRM, payment, or attribution platforms

* Familiarity with product or event tracking tools

* Experience designing data schemas and analytical models

* Experience migrating teams from spreadsheet-based reporting to centralized data systems

* Basic scripting or Python experience for data-related tasks



Why Join Us

This role gives you direct influence over marketing and growth decisions by bringing clarity and structure to data, improving decision-making across teams, and helping leadership understand what truly drives revenue and performance.

title: Cold Calling & Lead Qualification VA
description:
Need high-level English Proficiency and an US ability to make phone calls. 

We run a growing local U.S. newsletter and are looking for a reliable Virtual Assistant to help with outbound calling to local businesses.



This role is NOT sales.

Your only responsibility is to gauge interest and open the door for follow-up conversations with the founder.



You will not:



Close deals



Discuss pricing



Handle objections



Your job is simply to identify whether a business is open to learning more.

Responsibilities



Make outbound calls to local U.S. businesses using a provided list



Speak with owners or managers when possible



Deliver a short, provided script (no improvising)



Ask 2–3 interest-qualifying questions



Log call outcomes accurately in a shared sheet/CRM



Each call should be marked as:



Interested



Open / send info



Not interested



Call back later

title: Meta Ads Media Buyer (High-Risk Niches, performance bonuses included)
description:
Performance bonuses possible after 60 days based on results.



---



# About the Role



We are a performance marketing agency running Meta 
 & Instagram) ads for **high-competition and restricted niches** such as:



* Forex / Trading

* Crypto

* Nutra & similar verticals



We are looking for a **reliable, numbers-driven Meta media buyer** who can:



* manage multiple ad accounts

* execute structured testing

* optimize campaigns daily

* maintain stable CPL/CPA



You will **focus only on Meta ads execution and optimization**.

Strategy, budgets, tracking, and infrastructure are handled by the founder.



This is a **long-term, stable position** for someone who wants consistent work and growth.



---



# Responsibilities



### Campaign Execution



* Create and manage Meta ad campaigns across multiple accounts

* Maintain clean campaign structure and naming

* Launch and monitor new creatives



### Optimization



* Perform **daily performance analysis** (CTR, CPC, CPL, CPA)

* Apply structured optimizations based on data

* Pause losing ads and scale winners within defined rules



### Creative Testing



* Request new creatives using competitor examples or briefs

* Run organized testing of angles, hooks, and formats

* Monitor creative fatigue and refresh when needed



### Reporting



* Share **clear daily/weekly performance summaries**

* Communicate issues or risks early

* Work closely with the founder for direction and approvals



---



# What You Will NOT Handle



To keep the role focused and fair, you will **not** be responsible for:



* Budgets or payments

* Tracking tools or postbacks

* Cloaking or technical setup

* Client negotiations

* Overall business strategy



Your job is **execution, optimization, and stability on Meta**.



---



# Requirements



### Must Have



* **2+ years experience running Meta ads**

* Managed **multiple ad accounts at the same time**

* Experience in **at least one competitive or restricted niche**

  (crypto, forex, nutra, gambling, etc.)

* Strong understanding of:



  * CTR, CPC, CPL, CPA optimization

  * Creative testing workflows

  * Handling ad rejections or account issues



### Important



This role is **NOT suitable** for:



* Shopify-only e-commerce media buyers

* Beginners or trainees

* People who require full strategic control



---



# Ideal Candidate Traits



* Detail-oriented and consistent

* Comfortable working with **data and numbers daily**

* Calm under account bans or performance drops

* Proactive communicator

* Looking for **long-term stable remote work**



---



# Working Style



* Full-time remote

* Direct communication with the founder

* Async-friendly, but **daily activity is required**

* Long-term growth opportunity as accounts scale



---



# How to Apply



Please include the following in your application:



1. Your **years of Meta ads experience**

2. Niches you have personally run ads in

3. Maximum **daily ad spend** you managed

4. Number of **ad accounts handled simultaneously**

5. Briefly explain:

   **What is the FIRST thing you check when CPL suddenly increases?**



Applications without these answers will be ignored.

title: Executive Assistant to the CEO
description:
About Generation Success



Generation Success is a social impact organisation focused on social mobility, connecting young people from underrepresented backgrounds to white-collar employment opportunities. We work at the intersection of early careers, employer readiness, and systemic access — helping future-ready diverse talent reach the professional world, and helping employers build the workplace of tomorrow.

We are a small, ambitious team of six currently navigating a critical survival-to-scale phase. Our CEO, James Adeleke, also serves on the Education Board for the City of London Corporation and is a recognised voice in social mobility and early careers development. This role sits at the centre of the organisation.



About the Role

This is not a typical EA role. You will be the operational backbone behind a founder-CEO who balances strategic leadership, external board commitments, daily content creation, and the demands of building a mission-driven organisation with a young family.



You need to be someone who can anticipate what James needs before he asks, protect his time fiercely, and keep the operational machinery running so he can focus on the work that only he can do: strategy, partnerships, thought leadership, and external representation.



The right person will thrive in ambiguity, take ownership without being asked, and understand that in a team of six, everyone does whatever is necessary to move the mission forward.





Core Responsibilities

1. Diary & Time Management

 - Own and manage James's calendar — scheduling, rescheduling, and protecting focus time

 - Coordinate meetings across multiple stakeholders including corporate partners, advisory board members, the City of London Corporation, and internal team

 - Proactively manage scheduling conflicts and ensure adequate preparation time between meetings

 - Protect James's structured morning routines (meditation, journaling, brain training, content creation) by ensuring no early-morning scheduling intrusions



2.
 & Communications Management

- Triage and manage James's
 inbox — categorise, flag, draft responses, and ensure nothing falls through the cracks

- Draft replies and correspondence in James's voice and tone

- Manage LinkedIn messages and inbox — respond to all messages (not just sales) in a timely, professional manner

- Flag urgent items and escalate decisions that require James's direct input



3. Operational Support

- Prepare meeting agendas, briefing notes, and follow-up action summaries

- Support document preparation and formatting for board packs, partner proposals, and strategic documents

- Coordinate logistics for events including Open Your Doors Day, careers days, and roundtables

- Manage Asana tasks and project tracking — ensure deadlines are met and nothing stalls

- Support the team with ad hoc administrative, research, and coordination tasks as needed



4. Content & Thought Leadership Support

- Support James's daily LinkedIn content creation process — scheduling, light editing, engagement tracking

- Assist with preparation for speaking engagements, panel discussions, and board meetings

- Help coordinate thought leadership outputs including white papers, research briefs, and partnership communications



5. Family-Aware Flexibility

- Understand and accommodate the reality that James has a young family (3-year-old and baby) — emergencies happen, and this role requires someone who can hold the fort calmly

- Provide cover on scheduling and communications when James is managing family commitments





About You



Essential

- Exceptional organisational skills — you are the kind of person who brings order to chaos

- Strong written communication — you can draft professional
s, LinkedIn messages, and correspondence that sound like they came from someone senior

- Proactive mindset — you anticipate needs and act before being asked

- Comfortable with ambiguity — in a small team, your job description is a starting point, not a boundary

- Discretion and trustworthiness — you will have access to sensitive strategic, financial, and partnership information

- Confident using digital tools — Google Workspace, Asana, LinkedIn, Zoom, and willingness to learn new platforms quickly

- Genuine alignment with GS's mission — social mobility, early careers, and creating opportunity for young people from underrepresented backgrounds



Desirable

- Experience supporting a founder or senior executive in a startup or small organisation

- Familiarity with CRM systems (Go High Level or similar)

- Experience with social media management, particularly LinkedIn

- Comfort with AI tools — we use AI extensively across the organisation and expect tea
mbers to leverage these tools

- Understanding of the social impact, education, or early careers sector

- Sales support experience — some commercial activities may be part of the role depending on team structure



What We're Not Looking For

This role is not for someone who needs detailed instructions for every task, waits to be told what to do, or sees their responsibilities as limited to a fixed list. We need someone who sees a gap, fills it, and then tells us about it afterwards.



Why Join Generation Success

- Mission that matters: Every day, your work directly contributes to opening doors for young people who wouldn't otherwise have access

- Direct access to leadership: You work alongside the CEO, not three layers below — your impact is immediate and visible

- Growth stage exposure: GS is at a critical inflection point — you'll see and contribute to what it takes to scale a social enterprise

- Flexibility: Remote working with genuine flexibility — we care about output, not hours logged

- Network access: Exposure to corporate partners, City of London Corporation, advisory board members, and the broader social mobility ecosystem

- AI-forward culture: We don't just talk about AI — we use it daily. You'll develop skills that are increasingly valuable across every industry



How to Apply

Please send your CV and a short cover note (no more than 300 words) explaining why this role interests you and what makes you the right fit.



In your cover note, please address:

1. A specific example of a time you anticipated a problem before it became one

2. How you organise your own work and priorities

3. Why GS's mission resonates with you

title: E-commerce Operations & CRO Assistant
description:
A global hospitality brand selling across Shopify, Amazon, and TikTok Shop. We’re looking for a hands-on e-commerce operator to manage product content, improve conversion, and support testing across our online stores.

This is not a customer service role.

What You’ll Do

Manage product listings across Shopify, Amazon, and TikTok Shop

Upload and optimise product images, variants, and content

Make practical CRO improvements to product pages

Support and run A/B tests on Shopify and Amazon

Prepare and deliver print-ready product imagery for packaging

Shopify

Manage products, images, variants, and metafields

Edit themes/templates (Dawn or custom) safely

Improve PDP layouts, image order, and on-page copy

Amazon

Update listing images and A+ content

Optimise titles and bullet points (SEO-aware)

Run tests using Manage Your Experiments

TikTok Shop

Manage product listings and assets

Support TikTok-native product presentation and testing

title: Client Sales Reps Wanted ASAP
description:
CLIENT SALES REP - FULL-TIME POSITION FOR HIGH PERFORMERS ONLY



WARNING: This isn't your typical "dial and smile" appointment setting role. We're building the #1 renovation growth agency in Australia, and we need absolute killers who thrive under pressure and deliver results. If you're looking for an easy paycheck, keep scrolling.



About ReynMedia



We're a renovator-specific growth agency helping high-ticket renovators ($20K-$100K+ AUD projects) generate consistent revenue. Our clients close $100K+ monthly because we don't mess around with cheap leads or empty promises.



We're scaling FAST: 10 clients now, 50 ASAP, 100 by end of 2026.



Your Mission As Client Sales Rep:



You're the bridge between high-value homeowners and life-changing renovation projects. Every call you make impacts thousands of families getting their dream homes.



Core responsibility: Call and qualify 100% of inbound leads to achieve 30-40% qualification rate.



What You'll Do Daily:



- Call new leads immediately when they come in (speed matters)

- Follow up with existing pipeline prospects

- Qualify homeowners for $20K+ renovation projects

- Track Leads Via GoHighLevel CRM

- Send Leads To Our Clients Directly Via Slack

- Communicate With Our Clients On Lead Specific Information

- Deliver an exceptional customer experience on every call

- Track performance and submit daily reports





Schedule & Compensation:



Hours: 9am-5pm Australian Eastern Daylight Time (full-time)

Base + Commission: $5/AUD + $5 commission for every lead you qualify

Uncapped earning potential - our killers make serious money ($600+ AUD per week)



Requirements (Non-Negotiable):

- 1+ years phone-based B2C sales/appointment setting experience

- Proven ability to build rapport and trust quickly

- Experience with CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred, training provided)

- Elite level organisation and consistency

- Sales-driven mindset with positive attitude

- Available during mandatory hours



BONUS: Prior experience with renovators/home services



Our Culture (Can You Handle It?):

- Pure devotion to delivering best-in-class service

- Extreme accountability - we call each other out

- Elite standards - we don't settle for second place

- Growth focused - personal and professional development

- Fun - a work environment our team loves working in every day



This role is an entry point to higher positions. We promote from within based on performance, commitment, and competency.



Don't Apply If...

- You can't handle direct feedback

- You're just looking for any paycheck

- You don't thrive in high-performance environments

- You can't commit to consistent daily activity



How To Apply:



1. Fill out application form: 

2. MANDATORY: Record 60-second Vocaroo audio explaining why you'll crush this role

3. We respond within 24-48 hours if you advance to group interview



Applications without Vocaroo submissions videos are automatically rejected. 



Spots fill fast when we post these positions. Apply immediately if you're serious about joining the ReynMedia team and helping renovators and homeowners achieve their dreams.

title: Appointment setter/closer/trial activation
description:
Title: Trial Activation Specialist (US Market, SaaS Automotive)



We’re hiring a full-time Trial Activation Specialist to intercept new trial users in the first minutes after signup, diagnose their setup, improve their configuration, and qualify serious operators for a founder call.



This is not a traditional sales role.

This is not appointment setting.

This is not customer support.



APPLICATION VIA GOOGLE FORM BELOW!



Your job is to:



Contact new trial users immediately after signup



Understand how they currently source vehicles



Diagnose whether their Swoopa setup is correctly configured



Apply one or two tactical improvements live on the call



Identify serious operators vs casual testers



Book qualified operators into a follow-up call with the founder



Follow structured scripts and qualification criteria



Keep clean notes and tagging in the CRM



Participate in call reviews and process improvement





You are not expected to hard-close.

You are expected to think clearly, guide confidently, and qualify accurately. 





---



What You’ll Do



Call new trial users within minutes of signup



Ask structured diagnostic questions about their sourcing workflow



Guide users through quick setup improvements



Recognize high-intent operators using defined criteria



Book qualified users into a founder strategy call



Send brief SMS/email follow-ups when required



Log outcomes cleanly and consistently



Follow and improve scripts based on performance data







---



Requirements



Fluent or near-native American accent



Experience speaking with US customers



Prior SDR, appointment-setting, or closing experience (minimum 1–2 years)



Able to follow structured scripts without freelancing the pitch



Comfortable guiding users through simple technical steps



Calm, clear, non-pushy phone presence



Strong written English for short follow-ups



Reliable internet, quiet workspace, proper headset (important)



Able to work US business hours



Full-time, long-term availability





MALE ONLY applicants ? we are working in a male dominant niche. 





---



Performance Metrics



% of new trials contacted within 5 minutes of search creation. 



% of contacted users receiving a setup improvement



% of qualified operators booked to founder call



Downstream paid conversion rate of booked users

title: Executive Assistant / Operations Support (Remote)
description:
We are looking for a reliable, highly organized Executive Assistant to support daily operations and help keep our business running smoothly.



This role is best suited for someone who enjoys structure, follow-through, and clear expectations. You will work closely with the business owner and team to ensure tasks are completed, information is organized, and nothing important is missed.



This is not a role for someone who waits to be reminded.

It is a role for someone who takes responsibility and communicates clearly.



?



What This Role Is About



Your role is to support the business by:

 • Keeping work organized and up to date

 • Following up on open items

 • Helping prepare information so decisions can be made easily

 • Making sure tasks are completed properly and on time



You will not be expected to “argue” or confront anyone —

but you will be expected to follow up politely, consistently, and clearly until things are resolved.



?



Key Responsibilities



You will help with:

 • Maintaining and updating Google Docs, Sheets, and trackers

 • Following up with tea
mbers, contractors, and partners

 • Drafting and sending
s (not just reading them)

 • Tracking tasks and updating statuses

 • Preparing short daily or weekly summaries of:

 • What is pending

 • What is completed

 • What needs attention or a decision

 • Assisting with scheduling, coordination, and documentation

 • Supporting hiring calls or meetings when needed

 • Using tools such as:

 • Google Workspace

 • Slack

 • GHL (CRM)

 • Canva

 •
 tools

 • Using AI tools to help research, organize, and improve workflows



If you are assigned ownership of a document, keeping it accurate and updated is your responsibility.



?



Work Style & Expectations

 • Clear communication is required

 • Follow-ups should be done respectfully but consistently

 • Tasks should be completed without repeated reminders

 • Progress updates should be shared proactively

 • Response time during work hours: within 1 hour

 • Meetings and trainings are required



This is a calm, professional environment — but standards are high.



?



Who Will Do Well in This Role



You may be a good fit if you:

 • Are organized and detail-oriented

 • Enjoy completing tasks properly

 • Are comfortable following up when needed

 • Prefer clear instructions and structure

 • Want a long-term role with consistent work

 • Are open to learning and improving systems

 • Take pride in being dependable



?



Who This Role Is Not For

 • People who avoid follow-ups

 • People who disappear when unsure

 • People who prefer minimal responsibility

 • People who only do tasks when reminded



?



Compensation & Growth

 • Hourly pay

 • Consistent workload

 • Performance-based bonuses available

 • Hours and responsibility can increase with strong performance

 • Training and guidance provided



?



How to Apply



Please answer the question below in your application:



Describe a time you were responsible for keeping tasks organized or following up on work. How did you make sure everything was completed?



Thoughtful answers only — short or copied responses will not be considered.

title: Accounting / Bookkeeping - Remote (UK Construction)
description:
About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering the best value property maintenance has established us as a reliable partner for residential and commercial clients nationwide. With decades of experience, including 50 years of expertise in garage conversions, we pride ourselves on impeccable craftsmanship, turning our clients' visions into reality while ensuring their properties remain in top condition.



Role Overview



We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Accounting Virtual Assistant to join our dynamic team. This role focuses on comprehensive financial management and accounting support, including UK-specific compliance requirements. The successful candidate will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, managing accounts payable and receivable, ensuring regulatory compliance, and providing essential financial reporting to support our expanding operations across Ireland and the UK.



Key Responsibilities

Bookkeeping & Financial Data Management



Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records for all business transactions

Data Entry: Process and record financial data with precision and attention to detail

Invoice Management: Handle invoicing processes and payment processing for clients and suppliers

Account Reconciliation: Reconcile bank statements and maintain accurate account balances

Bookkeeping: Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records using accounting software including MYOB



Accounts Management



Accounts Payable: Manage supplier payments, vendor invoices, and payment scheduling

Accounts Receivable: Monitor client payments, follow up on outstanding invoices, and manage debt collection

Cash Flow Management: Track and report on cash flow positions and payment cycles

Credit Control: Implement credit control procedures and manage customer payment terms



UK Compliance & Regulatory Requirements



CIS Compliance: Manage Construction Industry Scheme (CIS) compliance and monthly reporting

VAT Returns: Prepare and submit VAT returns ensuring full compliance with HMRC requirements

Tax Compliance: Maintain compliance with all UK tax regulations and submission deadlines

HMRC Submissions: Handle various HMRC submissions and correspondence



Payroll & Employment Administration



Payroll Management: Process PAYE (Pay As You Earn) and CIS payroll for employees and subcontractors

Employment Records: Maintain accurate employment records and statutory documentation

Pension Administration: Support workplace pension scheme administration and compliance

Statutory Payments: Calculate and process statutory sick pay, maternity pay, and other employment-related payments



Financial Reporting & Analysis



P&L Preparation: Generate comprehensive Profit & Loss statements and financial reports

Financial Analysis: Provide financial analysis and insights to support business decision-making

Management Reporting: Prepare regular financial reports for management review

Budget Support: Assist with budget preparation and variance analysis



Tax Preparation & Professional Support



Tax Preparation: Prepare and organize documentation for annual tax returns and submissions

Professional Liaison: Work closely with external accountants and tax advisors

Audit Support: Provide documentation and support during audits and financial reviews

Compliance Monitoring: Ensure all financial practices meet regulatory standards



Required Skills & Experience



Essential Qualifications



UK Tax Knowledge: Strong understanding of UK tax system, VAT, CIS, and PAYE regulations

Construction Industry: Experience with construction industry accounting and CIS compliance preferred

Compliance Expertise: Knowledge of HMRC requirements and submission processes

Accounting Software: Proficiency in accounting software (Sage, Xero, QuickBooks, MYOB or similar platforms)



Application Instructions:

Application Instructions:

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

title: Quantity Surveyor / Office Engineer – Domestic & Commercial Brickworks (UK & Australia Projects)
description:
Please follow the application instructions below.



About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering the best value property maintenance has established us as a reliable partner for residential and commercial clients nationwide. With decades of experience, including 50 years of expertise in garage conversions, we pride ourselves on impeccable craftsmanship, turning our clients' visions into reality while ensuring their properties remain in top condition.



Role Overview

We are seeking a detail-oriented Quantity Surveyor/Office Engineer to join our dynamic team. This multifaceted role combines quantity surveying expertise with office engineering and financial administration, focusing on accurate cost estimation, project budgeting, and comprehensive project support. The successful candidate will work closely with our project managers, site teams, and clients to ensure precise cost control and seamless project delivery from concept to completion.



Key Responsibilities



Cost Estimation & Quantity Surveying



Project Estimating: Calculate materials, labor costs, and overall project budgets with precision

BOQ & BOM Preparation: Develop comprehensive Bills of Quantities and Bills of Materials for all projects

Job Pricing: Analyze construction plans and prepare detailed quantity requirements and pricing structures

Contract Analysis: Scrutinize maintenance costs, material expenses, and contracts to secure optimal deals

Tender Management: Analyze tenders and manage procurement processes for construction and design projects

Prepare accurate brickwork and blockwork quantity take-offs, including bricks, blocks, mortar, lintels, insulation, and related masonry components

Analyze brickwork labor and material rates to ensure competitive and accurate pricing



Project Coordination & Client Management



Stakeholder Liaison: Coordinate with site managers, clients, contractors, and subcontractors to ensure smooth project execution

Reporting: Prepare comprehensive reports, analyses, contracts, budgets, and risk assessments

Strategic Advisory: Advise managers and clients on cost improvements, new strategies, and savings opportunities

Change Management: Document design changes and update budgets accordingly

Material Management: Track materials inventory and coordinate ordering when required



Financial Administration & Office Support



Invoice Management: Handle invoicing processes and perform data entry for financial documentation

Administrative Support: Assist staff accountants and handle various office and financial tasks

Client Administration: Manage administrative tasks delegated by clients with efficiency and accuracy



Required Skills & Experience



Technical Requirements



Quantity Surveying: Proven experience in cost estimation, BOQ preparation, and quantity surveying methodologies

Construction Knowledge: Strong understanding of construction processes, materials, and industry standards

Financial Acumen: Experience with budget management, financial reporting, and cost control

Contract Management: Knowledge of construction contracts, procurement, and tender analysis

Simpro Experience: Hands-on experience using Simpro for job costing, project budgeting, invoicing, and workflow management



Professional Skills



Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities with exceptional attention to detail

Software Proficiency: Competency in quantity surveying software, spreadsheet applications, and financial systems

Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills for client and contractor liaison

Organization: Outstanding organizational skills with ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

Adaptability: Flexibility to handle diverse administrative and technical tasks



What We Offer



Competitive salary package.

Opportunity to work with self-builders across Ireland and the UK.

Professional development and training opportunities.

Collaborative and supportive remote work environment.

Career growth potential within an expanding company.

Involvement in diverse construction and visualization projects.

Remote working flexibility with comprehensive project support systems.

Experience working on international projects with diverse clients.



Application Instruction:

Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

title: Video Editor
description:
Youtube Video Editor (Full-Time)

- $900 per month

- Remote

- Flexible Hours

- Autonomy



We are currently seeking a talented video editor to join our team and produce high-quality long form content for our Youtube Channel, which focus on public challenges, fitness, lifestyle, and motivation. The successful candidate should possess strong editing skills, have a deep understanding of how to maximize views and engagement, and have a high level of English, so they can include banter and cultural references in the videos.



We are looking for someone who can create and post multiple Youtube videos per week that typically span from 8 to 30 minutes in run time. The expectation for videos created and posted will vary based channel growth and direction. 



The perfect candidate will be able to create binge-worthy content that keeps viewers engaged, adhere to tight deadlines, and deliver quality work with minimal revisions. They should be organized, communicative, and be able to work quickly. You should be able to deliver items through 
, Capcut, or Google Drive (We will provide access). Having a good sense of humor is a bonus.



You should add sound effects and background music where applicable, and source and use copyright-free clips and stock footage to use licensed clips. The videos should be edited in a binge-worthy style and be at least 1080p HD, with lower-thirds, text, and transitions where necessary. We expect you to work only with professional video editing software like Adobe Premiere Pro, Capcut, Davinci Resolve, or Final Cut Pro.



You will be paid $900 per month. If you satisfy these requirements and are interested in the position, please apply.





APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS:



You will be required to submit a mini sample. We want to see your skills on display! Use the raw footage provided to edit the beginning of a Youtube Video called "Win $1 Per Push-up". As you will see in the raw footage, the video is about a public challenge where people win $1 for every push-up completed. The sample should be at least 30 seconds. Use the examples below to get an idea of the pace desired. 



Examples of editing style and pace desired: ----------









Raw Footage (A camera and B Camera):









Step 1: Make sure the subject line of your message is "I'm Your YT Editor!"



Step 2: Include your Mini Sample



Step 3: Briefly answer this question: What are the three most important things to you in life?



Thank you!

title: EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT – PROPERTY MANAGEMENT (REMOTE)
description:
Remote (Work from Home – must have reliable computer & internet)

Full-time (40 hrs/week) | Independent Contractor



**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We’re a small, long-term rental company looking for a sharp, resourceful, and people-savvy Executive Assistant to support day-to-day operations.



This is not a corporate job and NOT an entry-level position.

We’ll train you on the “what” — but we need you to bring the “how.” That means:

**Thinking on your feet

**Solving problems before they escalate

**Speaking English clearly and confidently on the phone

**Caring about the work like it’s your own



We value people who treat the business like they’re part of it — not just clocking hours. If you’re the kind of person who goes the extra mile because you take pride in doing great work, you’ll thrive here.



**WHAT YOU’LL ACTUALLY DO**

• Be a reliable, professional point of contact for current tenants

• Manage lease renewals and ongoing tenant communication

• Make phone calls to gather info, follow up, and resolve issues

• Coordinate tasks, track details, and prevent things from falling through the cracks

• Help solve problems independently — and escalate only when needed

• Keep the owner organized and focused



-> This is not a checklist-following job. It’s a *thinking* role for someone who can move fast, stay calm, and figure things out.



**WHO THIS ROLE IS PERFECT FOR**

• *You speak clearly, confidently, and professionally in English — especially on calls*

• You’re a natural problem solver who can handle unexpected challenges without panic

• You think fast, take initiative, and don’t need hand-holding

• You genuinely care about the quality of your work and the business you’re supporting

• You’re someone who prepares, researches, and shows up ready

• You value long-term stability and being part of a trusted team



-> No property management or sales experience required

-> *Training provided — but success in this role depends on your ability to communicate smoothly and handle live conversations with clarity and confidence*



**WORK SCHEDULE**

• Full-time (40 hours/week)

• You choose your exact working hours, but must be reachable and responsive during U.S. Pacific Time business hours (7 AM – 7 PM, Mon–Fri), with active work occurring within that window



**COMPENSATION & GROWTH**

*Base pay up to $800/month to start,* with performance-based increases and bonuses for reliability, initiative, and strong work ethic.

Long-term role with real stability — no short-term rentals, no Airbnb chaos

Direct collaboration with the business owner — your work will actually make a difference



**FROM A CURRENT TEA
MBER**

“Working with Heavenly Happy Homes over the past year has been an experience I am truly blessed and grateful for. It has indeed been life-changing. From the very beginning, I felt trusted, supported, and encouraged to do my best. That kind of environment makes a huge difference, especially when working remotely. After going through uncertainty in a previous role, I was really praying to find a company where I could grow, learn, and feel secure long-term. Heavenly Happy Homes turned out to be exactly that and more. You genuinely find yourself loving the company and sincerely caring about the work you do. The culture here is respectful and collaborative, and everyone truly wants to see each other succeed. Even as a remote team, there is a strong sense of teamwork and shared purpose, which I honestly love. Training is efficient and well guided. R.S. helped me a lot, especially in understanding processes clearly. Another thing I can sincerely say is that hard work here never goes unnoticed. It is always valued and genuinely appreciated. Our boss is truly a wonderful employer!”



**HOW TO APPLY**

Submit your application here: 

Applications through OLJ may not be considered. Please complete the application at the link in this post.

title: Social Media Manager / Content Creator (Canva + CapCut Expert)
description:
Salon Marketing Solutions is an Australian-based marketing education company supporting beauty salons, skin clinics, and aesthetic businesses across Australia and New Zealand. We provide done-for-you campaigns, strategic mentoring, and practical tools to help clinic owners grow consistently and confidently.



You’ll be joining us at an exciting time as we prepare to relaunch our new brand, we are looking for a talented Social Media Content Creator who can take full ownership of managing, growing, and optimising our social media presence, with a focus on driving engagement, brand visibility, and follower base. 



This is an exciting role for someone who loves graphic design and taking a brand to the next level! You will be working directly with the business owner to relaunch and rebrand her online course for men. You will be directly responsible for managing all organic social media accounts and creating all organic social media content. Professional branding guidelines, professional photography & videography will be supplied to you. You will be supplied with clear content pillars, however we are open to collaboration on ideas.  You’ll be responsible for creating and managing monthly content calendars, producing engaging captions and scripts, creating thumbnails for reels/shorts, posting on all platforms daily, creating social media templates & researching competitors. You must be highly creative, have an eye for detail and confident in delivering creative content that is modern, engaging and elevated. 



Key Responsibilities:



Managing all organic social media accounts ( IG, TikTok, FB & YouTube Shorts) The same content can be used on all platforms in different variations. 

Design graphics, carousels, thumbnails and branded templates in Canva or Adobe Photoshop.

Edit short-form videos (Reels/TikToks) using CapCut, Captions, or Adobe Premiere Pro.

Create monthly content calendars aligned with campaigns and brand goals.

Write SEO captions and select hashtags to maximise reach and engagement.

Stay updated on social media algorithms, platform updates, and emerging trends.



Must-Have Skills & Experience:



Proven experience managing social media channels for a business. 

Strong copywriting skills with the ability to write engaging, on-brand, and SEO captions.

Proficiency in Canva, and CapCut (Adobe tools are a bonus).

Solid understanding of branding, visual design, and content strategy.

Highly organised with the ability to meet all deadlines across multiple accounts.

Strong problem-solving skills and initiative to work without constant supervision.

Warm and professional communication style.

Highly desirable, but not necessary, an understanding of Meta Business Guidelines for content related to men's health 





Important Notes:



This is a remote role. You must have reliable internet and be responsive during agreed working hours.

Attention to detail is critical, adhering to brand guidelines and content pillars across all platforms.

Only serious applicants looking for a long-term role with growth opportunities should apply.

All content must be revised and approved by business owner prior to posting

You should be comfortable with men's sexual health as a topic. 





What’s in it for you? 



250 AUD/week during probation

title: Social Media Specialist
description:
Salon Marketing Solutions is an Australian-based marketing education company supporting beauty salons, skin clinics, and aesthetic businesses across Australia and New Zealand. We provide done-for-you campaigns, strategic mentoring, and practical tools to help clinic owners grow consistently and confidently.



Please ONLY apply if you have experience in the ff:
 Marketing, Meta Ads, Canva Pro, Meta Business Suite 



Recruited and Trained by Vanessa McDonald Consulting – Installed™ Service

Installed™ builds in-house marketing capability for beauty and skin clinics.

This role is a 4–6 week training and placement pathway, preparing you to run the full social media marketing function inside a clinic — not as an agency, but as an embedded tea
mber.



Purpose: 



To lead and execute a clinic’s social media marketing strategy, design, content, engagement, and paid ads — with the goal of growing visibility, followers, and lead lists. You will be placed with a growing clinic business (to be advised at the second interview) and work directly with the clinic owner following installation.

 marketing will be required on an ad-hoc basis to complement social strategy.

This is an incredible opportunity to learn directly from Vanessa McDonald — one of Australia’s most respected marketing strategists in the professional beauty and skincare industry, with 24 years of experience guiding clinics to build sustainable, high-performing marketing systems.



You’ll be trained in:



The beauty, skin, and aesthetics industry — treatments, terminology, and client psychology.

The specific clinic’s business, brand, and product range.

 marketing systems used within the industry, including Phorest or Shortcuts (training provided for these only if the clinic you are placed with uses these particular platforms).



Core Responsibilities: 



- Develop and implement Instagram and
 strategies that drive engagement, growth, and qualified new client leads.

- Manage Meta Ads end-to-end: strategy, creative, setup, optimisation, and reporting.

- Confidently operate within the Meta Business Suite and Ads Manager, keeping up to date with current Meta tools and best practices.

- Design high-quality, on-brand content in Canva Pro, following the clinic’s brand style guide.

- Create and edit reels and short-form videos using apps such as CapCut or similar.

- Write fluent, polished UK English captions and campaign copy that reflect the clinic’s tone of voice.

- Manage DMs and engagement daily — responding to enquiries, nurturing prospective clients, and connecting with local influencers and aligned businesses for collaboration opportunities.

- Build and send
 campaigns using Mailchimp or the clinic’s in-house marketing system (Mailchimp expertise is essential).

- Utilise AI tools to enhance efficiency while preserving human judgment and creative quality.

- Prepare concise monthly reports covering organic performance, ads, and
 activity.

- Once Installed, you’ll work directly with the clinic owner using a clear communication and project management system that sets expectations, deadlines, and approvals.



Required Experience & Skills



- Minimum 3 years’ proven experience in social media strategy and Meta Ads management.

- Demonstrated results in organic audience growth and engagement.

- Strong proficiency with Meta Business Suite, Ads Manager, data analysis, and reporting.

- Advanced Canva Pro design capability with excellent attention to detail. We’re seeking candidates who can create clean, professional artwork and design aligned to brand standards.

- Confident in photo editing and basic retouching to ensure all visual content is polished, consistent, and on-brand.

- Skilled in reel creation and short-form video editing (CapCut preferred).

- Expert in Mailchimp, including automation, segmentation, and reporting.

- Adaptable to other industry platforms such as Phorest or Shortcuts (training provided for these systems only).

- Familiar with ManyChat or similar tools for automated lead capture.

- Excellent written and spoken UK English for an Australian audience (10/10 fluency).

- Reliable, responsive, and professional in remote settings.

- Must successfully complete a test task before onboarding.



Work Structure & Conditions

Part-time: 20 hours per week (remote, flexible)

Training rate: $175 AUD/week (4–6 weeks)

Probation (3 months): $200 AUD/week

Post-probation: $220 AUD/week

After 12 months: $250 AUD/week

Performance bonuses apply for meeting or exceeding campaign KPIs and results benchmarks.

If you prefer full-time work, you may be placed with two clinics instead of one.

All recruitment, training, and placement are managed through Vanessa McDonald Consulting – Installed™.



To maintain quality and focus:

You cannot work with other beauty or skin clinics in Australia or New Zealand.

You may retain a small number of freelance clients outside this industry, provided your total weekly workload remains under 50 hours.

You’ll have full ownership of strategy ? design ? captions ? scheduling ? reporting, supported by structured systems, brand training, and direct client collaboration.



Hiring Process



Application review: We assess your cover letter, résumé, and portfolio for relevance and quality.

Initial interview: A video interview with our recruitment specialist to discuss experience, fit, and expectations.

Test task: You’ll complete a short assignment to demonstrate your ability in design, content creation, and social strategy.

Final interview: Successful applicants are invited to a second interview with Vanessa McDonald.

Presentation matters — please ensure a professional appearance, a stable internet and audio connection, and a tidy background during interviews.



Fill out this form to apply:

title: Graphic Designer for Australian Market
description:
PLEASE do not apply to this role if you do not have experience doing graphic design in the Australian market. 



We’re expanding our creative team and looking for a Graphic Designer who can bring strong design expertise, creativity, and brand storytelling to life across digital and print platforms with a focus on delivering polished, on-brand designs that support our clients in the beauty, aesthetics, and service-based industries.



About the Role:



This is a hands-on, creative, and detail-oriented role for a trained graphic designer who can design across a wide range of materials, from social media tiles to pitch decks, promotional flyers, landing pages, and branded collateral. You’ll be working closely with our marketing and creative teams to ensure all visuals are aligned with brand goals, resonate with the Australian market, and meet high design standards.



UI/UX design experience is highly valued, as you’ll also support in creating intuitive, visually compelling layouts for websites, Shopify, and Kajabi pages. The ideal candidate is highly organised, comfortable handling multiple projects at once, and confident delivering professional work within deadlines.



Key Responsibilities:



- Design high-quality graphics, presentations, and marketing collateral including pitch decks, brand guidelines, social media tiles, flyers, and promotional materials.

- Create visually engaging landing pages, Kajabi designs, Shopify graphics, and Hubspot/Klaviyo assets.

- Maintain brand consistency across all platforms, campaigns, and client deliverables.

- Collaborate with the marketing team to translate strategy into compelling visual executions.

- Adapt and optimise designs for different formats and devices.

- Ensure all design output is aligned with Australian market trends and preferences.

- Prepare and deliver design files in appropriate formats for both print and digital use.

- Stay updated on design trends, UI/UX best practices, and industry tools.

- (Bonus) Edit short-form videos for social platforms if needed.



Skills Requirements: 



- 3+ years proven experience as a Graphic Designer, preferably with service-based businesses in the beauty or aesthetics industries.

- Formal design training and strong portfolio showcasing a range of creative work.

- Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, XD) and Canva.

- Experience designing for Shopify, Kajabi, Hubspot, and Klaviyo.

- Strong grasp of UI/UX design principles and ability to create clean, user-friendly layouts.

- Understanding of design requirements for the Australian market (experience working with Australian clients is a must).

- Excellent attention to detail, ability to follow brand guidelines, and deliver accurate work.

- Strong communication and collaboration skills.

- Ability to manage multiple projects independently and meet all deadlines.

- (Advantage) Video editing experience using CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, or similar tools.



Important Notes:



- This is a remote role: You must have reliable internet, a quiet workspace, and be responsive during agreed working hours.

- Hours: 20–25 hours per week

- Pay: 300 AUD per week

- Paid skills test will be required if you pass the initial interview.



We are only considering applicants with proven experience working with Australian clients.



Long-term applicants only — we’re looking for someone who wants to grow with our team.



CLICK TO APPLY:

title: Electrical Engineer / Quantity Surveyor - Remote
description:
About PropFix.ie



PropFix.ie is Ireland's trusted property maintenance specialist, offering comprehensive solutions with years of expertise across the construction and renovation sectors. We transform spaces through our diverse range of services, from handyman solutions and office fit-outs to complete renovations, house extensions, and specialized installations including doors, floors, and partitions.



Our commitment to delivering high-quality property maintenance and electrical solutions has made us a trusted partner for residential, commercial, and industrial clients nationwide. With decades of experience in electrical systems, installations, and maintenance, we take pride in our technical expertise and craftsmanship—ensuring our clients’ properties remain safe, efficient, and fully compliant with modern standards.



Role Overview



We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Electrical Engineer to join our team. This role involves electrical design, project coordination, system analysis, and technical documentation. The successful candidate will work closely with project managers, site teams, and clients to ensure accurate planning, safe installations, and seamless execution of all electrical works—from concept design to project completion.



Key Responsibilities

Electrical Engineering & Design



Electrical System Design: Develop, review, and interpret electrical plans, schematics, and load calculations.

Technical Specifications: Prepare detailed specifications, diagrams, SLDs (single-line diagrams), and layout drawings.

Material & Equipment Selection: Determine appropriate electrical components, materials, and equipment required for projects.

Compliance & Standards: Ensure designs meet electrical codes, safety standards, and regulatory requirements.



Project Coordination & Client Management



Site Coordination: Work with contractors, site engineers, and electricians to ensure proper installation and site execution.

Client Communication: Liaise with clients to clarify requirements, provide technical updates, and explain engineering decisions.

Documentation: Prepare project reports, progress updates, testing results, QA/QC records, and risk assessments.

Change Management: Document revisions to electrical plans and update load calculations, cost impacts, and schedules accordingly.



Testing, Maintenance & Quality Control



System Testing: Perform testing, commissioning, and troubleshooting of electrical systems and equipment.

Preventive Maintenance: Evaluate system performance and recommend maintenance schedules or upgrades.

Safety Compliance: Ensure all electrical work follows safety protocols, lock-out/tag-out procedures, and hazard assessments.



Financial Administration & Office Support



Cost Estimation: Prepare electrical cost estimates, material take-offs, and assist in budget planning.

Invoice & Documentation: Support invoicing, procurement coordination, and inventory updates for electrical materials.

Technical Records: Maintain accurate documentation, permits, and electrical certification records.



Required Skills & Experience

Technical Requirements



Electrical Engineering: Proven experience in electrical design, installation supervision, testing, and commissioning.

Codes & Standards: Strong understanding of local electrical codes, NEC/IEC standards, and safety regulations.

Technical Proficiency: Skilled in electrical drafting tools (AutoCAD, Revit MEP, or similar) and testing instruments.

Project Knowledge: Familiarity with construction processes, electrical layouts, and engineering documentation.

Professional Skills



Analytical Ability: Strong problem-solving and technical analysis skills.



Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication for client and contractor coordination.

Organization: Ability to handle multiple projects, documentation, and scheduling tasks efficiently.

Adaptability: Capable of managing both office-based work and technical project duties.



What We Offer



Competitive compensation package

Opportunities to work with clients across Ireland and the UK

Professional development and training programs

Collaborative and supportive remote work environment

Clear career advancement pathways

Exposure to diverse engineering and construction projects

Flexible remote working systems with comprehensive support



Please complete the attached application form and submit it along with your CV:

title: Social Media Creative + Reel Editor
description:
Social Media Creative + Reel Editor



Retainer | Instagram-Led | Pet Industry Brand



I’m hiring a highly organised, self-led content operator to take full ownership of weekly social execution.



This is not a VA role.

This is not a hand-holding role.

This is not a “wait for instructions” position.



You will be given direction and goals. You are expected to take that and run with it.



If you need daily checklists or constant approval loops, this role is not for you.



Weekly Scope



You will:



• Develop weekly content concepts

• Edit 5 Reels (raw footage provided)

• Design 5 carousels in Canva

• Create 5 supporting static posts

• Write captions

• Schedule across Instagram and

• Optimise and post Reels to TikTok

• Map content to TOF, MOF and BOF

• Organise content calendars clearly

• Communicate proactively and efficiently



Total: 15 pieces per week.



Estimated workload: 15 hours per week.



You Must Be:



• Highly organised and structured

• Proactive with ideas and execution

• Able to take a task and run with it

• Confident making creative decisions

• Strong in Canva design

• Skilled in Reel editing and pacing

• Comfortable thinking in funnels (TOF, MOF, BOF)

• Clear and efficient in communication



I do not micromanage.

You will not be spoon-fed.



Ownership is part of the role.



Platforms



Instagram (primary)

 (repurposed)

TikTok (Reels adapted natively)



You must understand platform nuance and how content behaves differently across them.



Non-Negotiables



• You must provide Reel examples you personally edited

• You must be comfortable on retainer

• You must be proactive, not reactive



Applications without portfolio links will not be reviewed.



Application Instructions



To confirm you’ve read this entire listing, begin your application with the words:



The Standard



Then include:



1. Portfolio

   Links to 3 Reels you personally edited.



2. Micro Strategy Task - 



 Create one Reel concept you would produce this week capturing on of the pain points above. 



I am a marketing coach for Pet brand in the service industry. 



Pain Points I Address in my content - my audience says -



• “I know I’m good at what I do but I don’t feel taken seriously.”

• “I’m fully booked but not making enough.”

• “I’m tired of chasing leads.”

• “I don’t know what to post.”

• “I’m doing everything and nothing is working properly.”

• “I’m scared to scale.”

• “I don’t want to be salesy.”



Desires You’re Tapping Into



Not surface desires. Deeper ones.



They want:



• To be respected in their industry

• To be the go-to name locally

• To have a waiting list

• To charge without guilt

• To feel confident on camera

• To run a real company, not a hustle

• To scale without losing their love for dogs

• To be known for expertise, not discounts



Include:

   • Hook

   • On-screen text

   • Caption

   • Where would it fit in a funnel? TOF, MOF or BOF

   • Why it would perform



3. Time Test

   Realistically, how many hours would this weekly scope take you?



4. Organisation

   Briefly explain how you organise weekly content production and deadlines. What would be the step by step process of our communication?



5. Availability

   How many hours per week can you commit long term?



6. Retainer Expectation

   Your weekly or monthly rate.



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered.



This role is for someone who wants autonomy, ownership and long-term growth with a brand.



If you are creative, strategic, highly organised and take initiative without being managed, I want to see your work.

description:
About Us

I run a business coaching and business education company based in Australia called Canberra Business Accelerators.

We help business owners improve profit, team performance, and business systems.

We are a stable, growing business and we are looking for someone long-term who wants to grow with us, not short-term freelance work.



The Role

• Business growth

Option 1 – Part-Time (Higher Experience / Higher Hourly Rate)

• Marketing support

• CRM systems

• Automations

You may start part-time with higher responsibility.

Content & Interview Processing

• Organising video, transcript, and image files

 & Blog Support

title: Quantitative Research Consultant
description:
About the Role



We’re looking for a Quantitative Research Consultant who loves working with data and sees analysis as both a science and a creative process. You’ll play a key role in transforming raw data into clear, actionable insights that help clients make confident, strategic decisions.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys spotting patterns, uncovering trends, and turning numbers into stories that actually mean something to stakeholders.



Working in a fast-paced, client-focused environment, you’ll contribute to the quantitative side of research projects from design through to insight and recommendation.



Key Responsibilities



Support survey design and questionnaire scripting

Clean, process, and analyse quantitative data

Produce data tables and outputs using research software

Conduct statistical analysis to identify insights, trends, and patterns

Translate quantitative findings into clear, actionable insights

Prepare accurate, client-ready reports and presentations

Integrate quantitative findings with qualitative insights when required

Analyse research data to develop strategic recommendations for clients



Qualifications & Experience

Tertiary qualification in a related field

(e.g. Statistics, Economics, Business, Marketing, Data Analytics)

At least 1 year of experience in market research or a data-focused role

Strong analytical and quantitative skills, including statistical analysis

Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, with working knowledge of Word and PowerPoint

Experience with research or survey platforms (e.g. Q Research Software or similar)

Familiarity with online survey tools such as SurveyMonkey

Experience with data processing, databases, and large datasets

Experience using statistical software (preferably SPSS)

Experience scripting and working with online data collection tools



Why Join This Role

Work with international clients across diverse industries

Be part of a collaborative, insight-driven team

Opportunity to grow your analytical and consulting skillset

Remote-friendly, performance-focused culture

title: Senior Administrative VA
description:
*This is not a regular or entry-level VA role*.



We are looking for an exceptionally competent, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support the operations of a fast-growing online business led by a high-profile creator and legal professional.



This is not a basic VA role. We need someone who thinks ahead, catches inconsistencies, understands priorities, and treats deadlines and accuracy as non-negotiable. You will be trusted with owning real responsibility across admin, sponsor coordination, affiliate support, and internal operations.



You must be ready to be online at varying hours as our team is global and shifts timezones regularly. There are also occasions where urgent tasks require you to be online at alternate hours.



We care less about your past experience and more about your desire to do things properly and carefully.



If you are the type of person who double-checks everything, asks smart clarifying questions, thinks 2 steps ahead, always has a plan B, always wants to improve with feedback, and genuinely cares about doing things well and finding a role they can grow with, this role may be a great fit.



This is a long-term position for the right person, with a competitive starting rate and a strong roadmap to increase your salary over time, along with annual bonuses, each according to your performance.



Key Responsibilities:

- Administrative support across multiple business areas (sponsorships, affiliates, internal operations, customer service, brand communications)

- Managing and coordinating
 communications and reports with external partners (brands, sponsors, affiliates)

- Focus on KPIs and keeping yourself and team on track with goals. Flagging when we are not on track, showing us how to get back on track, and actioning on that.

- Flexibility in managing schedules and jumping in for urgent or important out-of-hours situations for campaigns and events.

- Tracking deadlines, deliverables, and follow-ups with extreme accuracy, keeping yourself and the team accountable and catching mistakes before they become serious

- Supporting internal programs and communities (including memberships and customer support routing)

- Executing tasks based on SOPs while also flagging issues, gaps, or potential improvements

- Communicating clearly and proactively when something does not make sense or needs clarification

- Ensuring nothing slips through the cracks, impeccable organization

- We care far more about how you think and work, and your drive to grow and improve, than your exact past job titles and experience.



You are likely a strong fit if you are:

- Extremely detail-oriented and careful with timelines, instructions, and communication

- Highly responsible, reliable, and consistently on time

- Ready to commit to a full-time, long-term role

- Flexible to switch shifts to accommodate meetings and campaigns that run over different timezones

- Proactive and thoughtful (you notice problems before they become problems) and take action to get yourself and our team back on track

- Comfortable juggling multiple priorities without losing accuracy

- Trustworthy, discreet, and professional

- Genuinely invested in doing good work and growing long-term in a role

- Someone who takes ownership rather than just “completing tasks”

- Have a talent for communicating efficiently with C-level executives and clients

- Backgrounds that often do well in this role include (but are not limited to):

- Paralegal or legal assistant

- Executive assistant for a high-profile individual

- C-level operations or high-stakes admin roles requiring high precision

- Any role where mistakes had real consequences

- Experience with online tools is a plus, but not required if you are a fast learner. We have strong SOPs and clear processes in place.



Work Style & Expectations:

- Fully remote

- Long-term role (not a short-term gig or a part-time gig)

- Clear communication and accountability are essential



You will be trained, but you are expected to think independently and ultimately be the one owning and building your own SOPs, projects, and campaigns



Quality and accuracy matter more than speed



This role is not a fit if you:

- Want a basic admin job

- Are not comfortable with flexible hours or be on standby for certain times

- Want something short-term

- Are not eager to grow your career long-term

- Are not confident in an English business environment

- Are not comfortable with tech and learning tech



Trial Process

- Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a paid trial period (1–2 weeks) to ensure a strong mutual fit.



To apply, please fill in the application form:

title: Client Relationship & Case Progression Admin
description:
UK & Dubai | Financial Planning & Wealth Management | Long-term role



We’re a UK & Dubai–based firm providing financial planning intertwined with wealth management, and we’re looking for a highly organised, process-driven Virtual Assistant to support our client operations team.



This is not general admin. It’s a structured role focused on case progression, follow-ups, accuracy, and keeping client work moving across multiple stages.



This is intended to be a long-term position. We’ll start with a part-time paid trial, with the intention to move to full-time quickly if it’s a strong fit.



?



About the role



This role suits someone who enjoys working in detail, following clear processes, and taking ownership of multiple client cases at once within a financial planning and wealth management environment.



You’ll work closely with our UK and Dubai team, helping ensure that planning work, reviews, and client actions progress smoothly without unnecessary delays.



?



Key responsibilities



Case progression & follow-ups (core focus)

 • Managing and updating a live case pipeline (
)

 - paperwork

 - transfer / ceding updates

 - valuations

 • Chasing clients for outstanding documents, information, signatures, or funds

 • Logging all contact clearly so progress and blockers are always visible



Post-initial meeting & review workflow support

 • Adding new prospects and cases to the pipeline

 • Booking and rescheduling meetings and reviews (call and
)

 • Managing diaries and keeping timelines up to date

 • Making sure each case has a clear next action and owner



Documentation & accuracy checking

 • Preparing document packs using templates and client information

 • Proofreading and checking documents for:

 - grammar and clarity

 - correct names, dates, figures and provider details

 - consistency between source documents and outputs

 • Supporting review letter preparation within a financial planning and wealth management context, including:

 - using AI tools and templates for first drafts

 - checking outputs carefully before sign-off

 - flagging anything that doesn’t look right



Reporting & oversight

 • Reviewing the pipeline daily to spot stalled or overdue cases

 • Producing priority lists and short progress reports (e.g. top 15 cases)

 • Escalating issues early with clear context and suggested next steps



?



Communication requirements (very important)



You must be comfortable with:

 • Professional written English 
s within a financial planning / wealth management setting)

 • Confident phone communication

 • Making calls to UK and UAE numbers

 • Following up politely but firmly with clients and providers

 • Summarising conversations clearly and accurately



Strong communication and attention to detail are essential in this type of client-facing planning environment.



?



Systems & tools



You’ll work with tools such as:

 • 

 • OneDrive / document storage

 • SOPs and process guides on Notion

 •
 and phone systems

 • WhatsApp (where appropriate)



Full training will be provided on our internal processes.



?



What we’re looking for



Must-have

 • Excellent written and spoken English

 • Confident making outbound calls

 • Very strong attention to detail

 • Process-driven and comfortable following SOPs

 • Organised, reliable, and able to manage multiple cases

 • Proactive mindset – you chase, follow up, and flag issues early

 • Experience using CRMs or task boards (Monday, ClickUp, Asana, HubSpot, etc.)



Nice to have

 • Experience in financial planning, wealth management, insurance, mortgages, or legal admin

 • Experience supporting client reviews or ongoing client relationships

 • Experience producing reports or pipeline summaries



?



Hours & progression

 • Flexible working hours (reliability is key)

 • Some overlap with UK working hours preferred

 • Starting with a part-time paid trial

 • Moving to full-time quickly if the role is working well

 • Long-term opportunity for the right person



?



How to apply



Please send:

 1. Your CV

 2. A short video giving an overview of your experience and explaining why this role suits your experience

 3. Answers to the following:

 • What tools have you used to manage tasks or pipelines?

 • Are you comfortable making regular phone calls to UK and UAE numbers?

 • Give an example of a role where you had to chase people repeatedly to get things done.

 • What hours are you available to work?

description:

We need someone that is very good with design and can build websites from start to finish without any help. Looking for someone that wants to stay with us long-term and grow with our company. - Building Websites from start to finish with Divi on WordPress using Divi Child theme.

- Editing/Updating existing WordPress Websites (mostly Divi and Elementor)

- Graphic creation and edits

- Miscellaneous digital marketing tasks



Skills & Qulaifications

title: Zoho CRM and Automation Specialist
description:

We are a growing, compliance driven digital services business seeking an experienced Zoho CRM and Automation Specialist to join us on a full time.



This is a long term role with no fixed end date. The right candidate may be working with us for many years. You will own the design, build, and ongoing optimisation of our Zoho ecosystem as the business scales.



This is a hands on implementation role, not advisory.



About the role



Zoho CRM is used as an operational system, not a record keeping platform for regulated data. The focus is on automation, workflow accuracy, and clean handoffs between teams.



Current and planned stack includes:



Zoho CRM Professional

Zoho Flow for automations



Zoho Forms, where required



Xero for invoicing, payments, and refunds

 and SMS communications

What we’re looking for



Required
