title: Full-Time Fiction Proofreader
description:
We are a growing romance publishing company seeking a highly detail-oriented full-time proofreader to review fiction manuscripts before publication.



Grammar and punctuation are typically already strong, so the primary focus of this role is careful quality review — identifying repetition, inconsistencies, awkward phrasing, timeline issues, and subtle narrative errors while preserving the author’s voice.



This is a long-term remote position with a consistent weekly workload and the opportunity to grow with our editorial team.



Responsibilities

- Proofread romance manuscripts for:

   - Repeated phrases or repeated sections

   - Character, timeline, or continuity inconsistencies

   - Awkward phrasing or unnatural dialogue

   - Formatting inconsistencies

- Light grammar and punctuation review where needed

- Leave clear comments and suggested corrections using Track Changes

- Deliver assignments on schedule



Requirements

description:

into paying customers.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in sales conversations, knows how to build trust

quickly, and doesn’t shy away from tough questions or hesitations from prospects.

Key Responsibilities:

needed

and ease

? Assist with scheduling, follow-up
s, and basic administrative tasks

What We're Looking For:

? Detail-oriented with solid administrative follow-through

? Experience with cleaning or home services (preferred but not required)

Technical Requirements:

? Minimum 30 Mbps wired Internet connection



? Quiet, professional work environment with no background noise

? Backup Internet and device for emergencies

Compensation & Hours:

? $5–$5.50 per hour (depending on experience)

? Full-time role

? Must be available during Canadain business hours 

To Apply:

Submit a short written or video message describing your experience with handling objections

and closing sales over the phone. Real examples or metrics from past roles are a plus.

title: Executive Assistant + Marketing Systems VA (CRM, Blog, LinkedIn, Google Business, Reviews, AI SEO)
description:
Overview

We’re a real estate brokerage hiring a long-term VA who can function as an executive assistant (organization, calendar, follow-through) while owning our marketing systems (blog publishing, LinkedIn, Google Business Profile updates, review process) and keeping our CRM clean. You will be managing recurring weekly workflows and making sure nothing slips.



This is not a sales role and does not involve cold calling. Lead follow-up is limited to administrative routing, confirmations, and keeping tasks moving inside the CRM.



Hours / Schedule

20–30 hours/week to start (can grow). Must overlap at least 2–4 hours/day with US Central time (Mon–Fri).



Pay

$X/hour based on experience. Performance bonus available after 30 days for consistent execution and quality.



Core Responsibilities



Executive Assistant / Organization



Calendar management: scheduling, confirmations, reschedules, protecting focus blocks



Inbox triage: flag priorities, draft replies, convert messages into tasks



Weekly planning: maintain master to-do list, deadlines, reminders, follow-up loops



SOP/checklists: document recurring processes and keep systems organized



File organization: Google Drive structure, naming conventions, keeping docs easy to find



CRM Administration (Follow Up Boss or similar)



Keep CRM clean: stages, tags, notes, tasks, reminders



Weekly cleanup: duplicates, missing info, correct routing/assignments



Ensure every lead/contact has a next step and due date (admin only)



Weekly report: new leads, pipeline status, overdue tasks, activity summary



Blog + AI Search Optimization (Practical SEO)



Draft, format, and publish blog posts based on our topics/outline



Write in a clear “answer-first” structure that performs well in Google and AI search:



40–60 word direct answer at the top



clear H2/H3 headings



5–8 FAQs at the bottom



internal links to relevant pages



Basic SEO on every post: title tag, meta description, URL slug, image alt text



Maintain a content calendar and hit deadlines (consistency matters)



LinkedIn Optimization + Posting



Repurpose blog posts into 2–4 LinkedIn posts/week



Schedule posts, keep formatting clean, and coordinate light engagement as directed



Keep profile/company page elements organized (Featured links, pinned posts, etc.)



Google Business Profile (GBP) + Reviews



Post updates to GBP 1–2x/week (photos, short updates, links)



Review system: send review requests using templates, track completion, send follow-ups



Draft or post professional responses to reviews (per our guidelines)



Success Metrics (How We Measure This Role)



Organization: calendar stays clean; priorities and deadlines tracked; nothing falls through cracks



CRM: minimal overdue tasks; stages/tags accurate; weekly report delivered on time



Content: X blog posts/month published; X LinkedIn posts/week published; GBP posts consistent



Reviews: review requests sent weekly; reviews responded to within 48 hours



Requirements (Non-Negotiable)



Excellent written English (professional, concise, strong grammar)



Strong organizational skills and task management



Proven experience with blogging/publishing workflows and basic SEO



Comfortable using CRMs and following SOPs



Reliable internet and consistent availability



Nice-to-Have



Real estate industry experience



Follow Up Boss experience



WordPress experience, Canva, Google Business Profile experience



How to Apply (Read Carefully)

Start your application with: “EA SYSTEMS VA” (so we know you read this).

Include:



Resume + 2 references



Links to 2 writing samples (blog or LinkedIn)



A 2–3 minute Loom video showing:



how you manage tasks/calendar (tools you use) AND



an example of a content workflow you’ve executed (publishing, SEO checklist, etc.)



Screening Questions (Required)



Which CRMs have you used, and what did you manage inside them?



Describe your weekly CRM cleanup checklist (stages/tags/tasks/duplicates).



Write a 150–250 word blog intro on: “How to choose the right listing price.”



Turn that topic into 2 LinkedIn posts (600–1,200 characters each).



For that same blog topic: write the meta description (max 155 characters) and a URL slug.



Describe your weekly process for Google Business Profile + collecting reviews.
